text: The food, service, and drinks were great! I loved the dish, Jenny's catch- the lobster sauce was out of this world and tilapia didn't taste fishy at all! The dish was recommended by the waitress whom was really nice to us as well! Great place on the strip! Has outdoor eating as well.
By far my worst dining experience in Vegas.  All the décor was great, but the service was not.  The food was bland and greasy.  I felt heavy and tired walking out of the restaurant.
Food was pretty good.    Service was okay.    My 20oz Bud Light was $13.72???????? WTF?!?!?

I spent and wasted 238.00 dollars on nasty food...jambalaya was hot and couldn't even taste flavoring...shrimp were over cooked rice was hard...kids pizza was not cook thoroughly and my husband ordered a burger medium rare...it look totally raw/pink....very upset about this Las Vegas Strip location.....would not recommend...and the service was not superb! It was mediocre!...

Where to start- food was ok and beer selection decent.  Very disappointed with our dessert.  But my son loved Forest Gump and just loved the theme, including getting all the questions correct on the quiz.  Biggest downside- very pricey but everything in that area was over priced.

I went in with family on Thursday. We parked at Planet Hollywood, took about 10 minutes to walk to the restaurant. The lower level is the gift shop which you have to walk thru to get up to the restaurant (of course). There's a patio with the view of the strip which was pretty nice and the waiter was good. The appetizer was awesome, we ordered the bubba far out dip (tortilla chips & spinach roasted bell pepper, artichoke and jack cheese). We had the seafood trio and surf & turf entrees, both dishes were too salty and the steak was a little overcooked. The fizzy fun and frozen lemon-ups beverages were awesome and we got to keep the glass. Overall, for the price we paid, we were disappointed and expected more. Will I go back? Probably not!

This was my first time eating at Bubba Gump and I'm sure it will be my last. I am not a picky eater but my boyfriend and I developed the worst case of upset stomach after eating here. The location is good and the service is wonderful...  BUT the food  just did not sit well with us.   We ordered the dip for an appetizer. It was okay, not super hot as it should have been. I ordered the shrimp poboy for an entree which was delicious. My boyfriend ordered the grilled chicken sandwich. Again, we are not food snobs and this was the first place we ate in the day. I'm gonna assume it was the dip that did us in. I really would love to give this place more stars. The waitresses are really good and attentive. But based on the vomiting and upset stomach my boyfriend and I both experienced after eating here I just can't. If you eat here maybe just stay away from the dip!
Service was fantastic and quick! Food was great!  Loved the Forrest Gump trivia and knowledgeable staff.

As a local, I was excited when we finally got one but my recent visit will cause me to never visit again. I ordered the grilled chicken sandwich & my friend ordered the mahi. Both meals came out really fast and as we started eating, we realized that neither piece of our meat was cooked. I am not one to ever complain at restaurants but the chicken was pink and raw. The fish was gummy and uncooked. After informing our waiter he talked to the manager who did nothing for us. We decided to order dessert to make up for our awful meal. The cookie in the dessert was so hard we couldn't eat it. We had to finally ask for a manager.. who went on to tell us he wasn't sure why we would be on the strip during Memorial Day weekend and that he would have a talk with the chef. I'm not sure why we ended up paying full price for everything. I am extremely disappointed.. I love this restaurant but won't go on to recommend this food or service to anyone.

The service was just terrible. Half the time we didn't even know who our server was. My friend ordered vegetables sautéed with NO butter and olive oil instead but got a bowl full of vegetables in a pool of butter.   The view of the strip is amazing from here though.
Very good shrimp and crab legs.  Staff was very nice and accompanying.  We were able to get right in no wait and food came out shortly after we ordered.

Pro: Good decent food.  My server was great and attentive although he had his hands full with so many tables.  I left my bag and had to go back for it, and the GM had it up front for me to pick up. Con: It's overpriced, but so is everything in Vegas.  Everything was going good until I had flipped the plate to show "stop Forrest Stop" to get my check slip.  The waitress supervisor, I'm assuming, came with another server and gave me an attitude of why I showed the sign and what I wanted.  I smiled and said, "check please."  My server gave me the check and so did the other one.  I gave my server 19% tip for good work, but a real ding for the rude supervisor.

The food was good, but overpriced.  Having said that, we did enjoy our dinner.  The servers were friendly.  We did have a reservation so got right in and seated. That was nice.   Be warned, if you have any difficulty walking, on crutches or in a wheelchair, it is a long distance from the parking garage or valet (which we did use).

The flavor and variety of the shrimp are excellent. It was served hot and fresh. The hostess was very friendly.  The waitress was not patient. It was our first visit, so we had a couple questions about the menu. She was irritated by this. If the restaurant was busy, I would completely understand. But, we were only one of five tables in the whole restaurant at the time.

Bubba gumps based on the movie Forest Gump, later the waiter quizzed me on how many Dr Peppers Forest drank, he said 15, theres also a Dr Pepper sign on the restaurant wall, prior to all that I asked for a Dr Pepper, waiter said they "dont have Dr Pepper"...  WHAT THE??  ...no Mr Pibb either...

We really enjoyed this restaurant.  We had good food and good service.  The only complaint I would give is being charged 15 dollars a beer and not letting us know the price. You get to keep the glass but what if you don't want the glass. I'm a bartender and I wouldn't just bring someone the larger size and asume they would want the glass. That's pretty rediculous.

I'm not sure why there are so many bad reviews on here. I think people sometimes make the time to leave that good ones out. Our server Chad #1 was awesome! The coconut shrimp was amazing! And so was the french fries, ranch, and mango strawberry chillers!

We had lunch here this past weekend for my gf bday at this location! First timers! Food was delicious definitely what I was expecting and a lot more. I had the surf an turf and my gF had the "in stuffed" both entrees were great. Only reason why I'm giving it 4 stars was because our waiter lagged with our alcoholic beverages and our appetizer we where one of 3tavles that got there first and we where the last ones to get our stuff other than that everything was perfect !

I've experienced Bubba Gumps once before coming to this one. When I heard Planet Hollywood was opening one I couldn't contain myself. The first thing you have when you enter is a souvenir shop which makes sense since there are a ton of tourists wandering the streets. you have to go upstairs to go to the actual restaurant. The walls are covered in Forest Gump memorabilia which makes it dangerous as you're walking up the stairs if you can't multi task.  Once we made it to the top the host asked whether we wanted to be seated inside, outside or at the bar. We chose outside and glad we did the view is AWESOME! Fast forward to ordering our food; our waiter was very helpful with explaining anything we had questions about and even offered suggestions. Most of the best tasting drinks come with a souvenir cup.   We ordered a bucket of shrimp, half Cajun half garlic & butter, they dumped it out on a giant platter so you can grub away. Be careful though it can get messy. We also ordered lobster stuffed shrimp on top of jasmine rice. It was very oily but when something is smothered in butter what can you expect. It mixed well with the rice. Couldn't finish everything so we took a to go box and our souvenir cups all for $75. A bit expensive but i'm sure it would have been cheaper without the cups. Overall great service, food and great time.

So let me just start off by saying that we love Bubba Gumps. We've gone to different locations and have had great experiences every time...except for this one. The restaurant wasn't very crowded. There was no wait, but we got seated in the very back room all by ourselves. Felt a little out of place and ignored. That was strike one.   Strike two was when we ordered. I wanted a dish that came with tilapia and just wanted a different fish like salmon or mahi mahi. Most places would say "sure no problem" but our waitress said "nope. We can't do that." Imagine my shock when a restaurant can't do a simple switch like that. It took several tries of me asking her to please go double check with the chef before she finally went to ask. She came back and what do you know..."oh okay we can switch that for you". It's just very irritating when a restaurant makes it seem like a hassle to do something simple for a paying customer.   After that whole incident I had asked for a comment card...and guess what. They don't have any. Of course they don't have any. So that's why I'm writing this here.  All in all food wasn't anything special and service sucked. Our food was cold when it came out and they just dropped it off without a word. There are so many options on the strip and you can find something a lot better! Needless to say I will not be returning or recommending this location to anyone.
Enjoyed the gumbo and the spinach dip. Unfortunately, the drinks were pretty weak. The server was nice, but be sure to check your receipt-they charge for souvenir glasses.

Me and my girlfriend ate here on the second night of our vacation, and we both had a really good time!  As big Forrest Gump fans we both loved the was the restaurant was decorated, especially for my girlfriend who had never been to a Bubba Gump before.  We both enjoyed our meals, and despite it being the busy dinner time our meals arrived in no time at all.  Portions were plenty, and both of us struggled to fit it all in.  Hardly a bad problem to have.  All in all we both had a very good dining experience; from the food, staff, and atmosphere.  A quick photo at the Forrest Gump bench and the experience is complete!  Highly recommended, whether you like shrimp or not.

While the food was good, the quantity is a pure RIP OFF. Having been to Bubba Gump across the country, the quantity of food is ridiculously small. The manager Denis does not know the meaning of Customer Service. He just kept a stupid smile on his face while saying that it is not his decision...he is the manager.

Typical fried food joint. I knew what I was getting in to before going, but over the years they have gotten really proud of their menu items and I can't really justify the price for what you get. While the fish and shrimp are cooked well, everything tasted the same and didn't have much flavor. The service was excellent hence the bonus star. Too expensive for a quick lunch.

This was my first time eating at Bubba Gumps and I was pleasantly surprised at how good the food was and at how great the service was.  Our servers name was Bryant and he was extremely chill and knew the menu pretty well. He made some menu recommendations and provided great conversation. Interacting with him makes me want to go back to Bubba Gumps Las Vegas.  WE NEED MORE SERVERS LIKE HIM!

My first time ever eating at Bubba Gump and I was impressed. Our Server Eva was fantastic, very friendly and very informative. She was an angel.  I had the fish and chips it was the best fish and chips I have had in a long long time.  Very happy will definitely recommend Bubba Gumps to others.

I stopped in just to have the Gumbo on my way back to Phoenix from Burning Man.  The service was excellent, the bartender made me the BEST strawberry lemonade that I've had the the food was stellar.  I can't wait to go back and eat again.

Awesome drop in spot. We didn't get shrimp like I wanted, but was thirsty. So I got the mango sparkler thing. Sat at the bar. Friend liked the Mama's bread pudding, price for portion was great. $8. My sparkler was sugary deliciousness. Julie and Grande were chill low key fun to talk to. Great Customer service Reppin for the brand. Hopefully we go back for shrimp before my birthday weekend is over.

Atmosphere is casual and laid back. The drinks are awesome. I had the New Orleans shrimp-slight metallic taste Andy rice was a bit dry. Also had the hush puppies--not traditional style hush puppies and slightly undercooked. My boyfriend had the jambalaya-it was great. Had the dessert sampler. None of them were up to par. My main detractor was that they wouldn't seat us until our entire party arrived-even though we were ordering drinks and appetizers. I still give them 3 stars for the atmosphere and drinks. But food left a little to be desired. Oh and the sun was in my eyes the entire time.
I had a great time here.  I took my dad here and it was a lot of fun and the food was excellent too.  The key is to this place, get drunk and eat!
Good service but the fish and shrimp were a little over cooked. The sauces tasted great though!
I have been to many Bubba gump locations and always had good time, but this one is really bad. Will never come back again. Rude servers, cold food and dirty everything..

We had dinner here last night while visiting las Vegas and the food and atmosphere were great! Drinks were amazingly tasty and the food was nice and hot! I do want to point out the friendliness of the staff... we were automatically greeted at the door. We were seated within minutes.. our waiter was very friendly..the food came quick.. and I also witnessed a server bringing drinks to a nearby table and a red slushy drink spilled and got on the customers white shirt. And it all happened in front of what I assumed was a manager. That manager did not hesitate to walk that customer to the gift shop and get him a free t-shirt...i thought that was pretty amazing!! 2 thumbs up Bubba Gumps

Roach showed up on the booth I was sitting at right before our meal showed up. It was literally next to my shoulder. The Waitress saw it exactly at the same time my husband pointed it out and she killed it with a napkin. Manager offered the free meal but we just couldn't get ourselves to stay to eat after experiencing that. They also gave my husband a free glass that came with the beer he ordered.. So that was nice of them.

Loved this place! Basically everything is fried or basted in butter so how can you go wrong. The hush puppies were amazing and the stuffed shrimp was good. The decor is adorable and I loved that the staff came around to quiz us on our Forrest Gump knowledge. We did alright lol it was a fun time overall!

The food was nasty. The shrimp was over cooked and cold! The bread was hard. I ask for no tomatoes they brought tomatoes! The person next to us had to return everything they ordered also! Would not recommend this location! On top of all that they didn't even try to make anything right!!

We have been to several other bubba gump's in the past and found the food and service to be great. The las vegas one on the other hand not so much. Our server was okay but the food wasn't that great. I had the (i think it was called) the seafood feast. Twenty two dollars for 4 small shrimp 4 hush puppys and supposedly fish sticks. Which where some deep fried breading with a sliver of fish inside. Would have been better off at fast food

Had a terrible experience at this place.  Prices are expected for strip... not extremely high.   First of all, I am the Front Office Manager of a major hotel.  I know service.  Our server was pretty good although our water stayed empty once we consumed.  Our issue was that someone from the kitchen delivered our two appetizers to the wrong table.  40 minutes later we asked where they were and they put this information together.   The manager came over and apologized for the delay and said he would personally bring them out when they were ready.  Not sure what that was supposed to do for us but he didn't personally bring them out anyway.   We decided not to order entrees after that debacle.  Our total bill was $74 (had 3 drinks, no biggie).  Asked manager to comp part of the bill for having to wait so long.  He told me, "I really can't do much for you, maybe a buck or two."  A buck or two?   Good service, bud.  Why would I go back to Bubba Gump?
This place was amazing! Employees cared a lot about you manager always check on how things were going very very good food!!! :) happy

Horrible.  Walked in. Greeter dropped menu and said 'here you go' coldly. Then we sat at the table for more than 15 minutes without even a drink order or a hello. 11:15am visit and it was dead there - probably 5 patrons. 6 workers were hanging out at the hostess stand when we walked out, enjoying themselves.  No one even noticed we were slowly walking out.

We went there with a party of 7 on our recent Vegas trip and were seated right away (it was a weekday). The service was really good. Our waiter played fun trivia games with us and the overall atmosphere for my "Forrest Gump" loving family was fantastic. We loved all of the little details that made the restaurant so nostalgic to the movie, including the "run forrest run"/"stop forrest stop" license plates on the table to use to get the waiter's attention. Perhaps it is a tourist attraction but overall we loved the place, loved the food, and enjoyed the service.

Worst food ever! We ordered calamari (breading was at the bottom of the basket) and there were more fried peppers than calamari... Then my boyfriend ordered coconut shrip and that had to many layers of coconut to where he could not enjoy the  shrimp... I ordered the something new orleans and the sauce was terrible.... we walked out hungry.

The service was great!  The food was very good and the drinks were delicious. The drinks are a little pricey but you get to keep the collectors glass when you are done. If it's a plastic glass they wash it and give it back to you. If it's a glass glass then you get a brand new one from the gift shop when you leave. The seafood hush puppies are amazing. We Weill return!!!

Came here on August 11, 2014 for dinner with my family. I've been to their location in San Francisco, so it isn't like I'm new to the place.  Pros of the night: -Our waiter (I believe is name was Andrew?) was very enthusiastic, when he came by and didn't seem like many other waters who literally look like they hate their job. -The food was very good.  Cons of the night: -The garlic bread was said to be out ASAP, but it came literally 3 minutes before our entrees came out. Mind you we had already been waiting for about 20 minutes. -I did not know that at this location you had to pay for drink refills. My first cup strawberry lemonade had an average amount of ice in it, so I was not complaining, but my second cup but literally a whole cup of ice. Why I had to pay $.99 for that, I don't know. -The sign "Stop, Forrest, Stop" is supposed to bring a waiter over quickly, but my sign was out for about 5 minutes before a waiter came, even though we were right next to their payment machine.

I wish I could give zero stars!!  This place sucks... I've eaten in the Orlando and New Orleans restaurants and loved it! This place sucked, bad food , worse service and the inability to bus a table and let us sit in the location we wanted to sit! Don't waste your time in this location!

Went to Bubba Gump on a Saturday night. It wasn't as busy as I had expected it to be. We used to always go to the one in Hawaii and I was craving their Hush Puppies (which btw is to die for). I've always loved Bubba Gump. It's cool how this entire restaurant is based off of the movie Forest Gump.   Anyways, the food selection didn't seem like there was as much as the menu in Hawaii. We mainly came for the Seafood Harvest but unfortunately it wasn't on their menu.   We ordered the Calamari for appetizers, Run Across America Sampler (as a meal), and the Trio for our entree. All three tasted pretty good and were up to our expectations on taste.   The service was mediocre. Nothing exceptional but not bad either. Our waitress was nice for the most part. There were a few times that it was hard for us to get her attention, let alone any otter waiter/waitresses attention, but we'll give them a pass since there were 3 birthdays while we were dining there.   Overall, I'd go back again. I wouldn't NOT recommend this place because it definitely hits the spot if you're looking for seafood on the strip with a very minimal to no waiting line.

Can I say delicious?? I love bubba gumps got to treat my fiancé out last night. I'm the beginning the service was a tad bit slow. But we had a certain waiter that would talk with us and ask trivia questions about the movie. Kinda pricey but still worth it
The food was delicious and the service was excellent! Jessica is an awesome server and Jenny's Catch was superb! The crab legs were seasoned to perfection I was well pleased with my experience !

Messed up our appetizer, messed up my husband's meal then they got my meal wrong too. We are easy to please folks who just wanted some lunch. After waiting 2 hours, we left w a bag of to-go food as we couldn't wait any longer. $50 for 2 lunch entrees (we had an appetizer coupon). The manager was trying to calm down the table of 9 next to us who had gotten their orders screwed up too. I'd pick somewhere else next time.

Good food! I was visiting Las Vegas with my husband. We went to the place for shrimp. I barely eat shrimp outside, because normally the restaurants don't peel the shrimp shit out......I know the shit is a line on the shrimp back.....when I order their shrimp,surprised me, they cleaned them so well. I was happy about this point! The food is really tasty, the service was good! I would like to recommend this place to my friend;)
Had a very nice time. Food was terrific. I sat on the belcony...great idea..great location....our server Erin was allot of fun and was very attentive. Defiantly would come again!!!

I was some what hesitant about eating here after reading the reviews but I am glad I went. The service was good. The server was patient and answered all my questions. The wait wasn't long and I was able to sit on the patio with the wifey. The food was good and I don't have any real complaints. We didn't wait long for our food and everything was hot. I don't understand all the bad reviews. I recommend it.

Came here after a friend in our party raved about a few things on the menu. And honestly, for what it is, Bubba Gump Shrimp is a pretty awesome place.  Started with the Hush Puppies, which were amazing (and came with a terrific dip); then did the Po Boy with Shrimp. Definitely not bad - the bread was a bit tough and the Mayo didn't quite stand-up to the other ingredients, but overall was still pretty good.  Also had a few Margaritas in the process.  Great service, clean environment, and awesome patio.

Today I have to give it 2 stars due to our rude waitress. When we first got there our menus were just dropped off at the table and told our waitress would be with us. Once the waitress arrived she attempted to rush us on our drink order we stated we were not ready she walked away came back asking are you ready now? Drinks were ordered and appetizers too I ordered a dip and my friend did too. Drinks come and appetizers too by a different server who brings us out two of the same appetizers. So we stated that we didn't order two of the same things. She states that ok no problem and then our waitress comes up to us and says rudely "Didn't you order the dip that you sent back" We attempted to tell her that we didn't want two of the same appetizers and she walked off with a attitude and service went down from there. We had to ask for togo boxes and the check from someone else due to the fact we couldn't find her again. Once the the check came she split the tab which was not asked if we wanted it that way. So now we had to wait for another receipt to be printed before leaving. I love this place but today was not the best.

I'm a local in Las Vegas and I went here after spending the day with my friend who came down for the Labor Day weekend and I always wanted to try the place. I love seafood and when I worked at Marshalls just a few blocks away one of my customers said to try the place if you want good seafood. The prices are great for the average seafood place. It's very lively there was two birthdays when we went which was a cute birthday song.  The service was good aside from when the waiter came over to do Forest Gump trivia he kept staring at him while my friend was with me at the table. It was a little unnerving to have him staring at me like that.  The food was okay but wasn't the greatest. I ordered the ship wreck platter and the crab was sweet as crab usually is, the breaded shrimp was delicious, the fries were great except for the misleading bucket it all came in, and sadly the battered fish was a let down as I love battered shrimp it lacked seasoning to it. The side coleslaw and the butter, didn't bring out the taste of the crab, wasn't that great either. My friend ordered their trio appetizer plate and she said it was good but the fish was overcooked for her liking.   The alcohol was very overpriced too but what do you expect from a restaurant on the strip except it cost a meal to have one.

My momma always said, "Life was like a box of chocolates. You never know what you're gonna get."  Well, no... actually Forrest Gump said that. MY momma always said, "For God's sake, Ryan, why can't you put down that Nintendo controller and play outside with the rest of the NORMAL kids? And what the hell are you wearing all that TINFOIL on your head for?"  No, Forrest Gump was the one who talked about chocolates, and Bubba always talked about shrimp, hence, we now have the chain of the Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. restaurants. They're all over in touristy spots, and the Seestur raves about the one in Anaheim in Gardenwalk. She even sports the sweatshirt proudly. This from a girl who would practically retch if she even got near seafood.  So boy, howdy, was I excited to see that there was going to be a Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. on the Las Vegas Strip. So excited, that I didn't even care it was located mere steps from the horrifying (to me) Goretorium. I was going to brave the danger and go to Bubba Gump, and if one of the evil scary monsters from Goretorium and/or one of the sleazy porno-card giver-outers on the corner of Harmon and the Strip came after me, well, by God I would buy fresh boxers from the Bubba Gump store.  If life is like a box of chocolates, I should have tried poking the bottom of the candies before coming here. I got stuck with that one everyone else dodges. You know, the one with the pink cream-ish center that's supposedly cherry or raspberry but tastes more like Pepto Bismol.  Las Vegans hardly need a reason to celebrate but we find them anyway, and as I had just been unceremoniously and hurriedly booted out the door by my former employer, ironically who stood across the street from Harmon Corner and rhymed with "Bosmopolitan," I decided to have a little "New Beginnings/I Got Fired" dinner at Bubba Gump's.  Figuring I was the last one there (as I usually am) and not wanting a demon to jump out of the Goretorium and eat my soul, I asked one of the store clerks, "So... I'm in the store... but where's the restaurant?" She smiled and directed me up the stairs toward the back of the store. A sign or something would have been nice.  I headed up the stairs, where I was actually first, gathered the party, and we were seated. They explained the license plates on the table that say "Run, Forrest, Run!" and "Stop, Forrest, Stop!" which I thought was a cute touch.  The crew was stellar. Our main waitress was super bubbly and thrilled when she heard we were all locals (like, apparently they had not been frequenting the place... what a shock no locals on the Strip). She was very attentive to our needs, to the point where we never really needed our "Run/Stop" plates on our table. She even regaled us with ghost stories in nearby mining towns. So despite whatever else I say in this review, the staff was great and should be commended.  And with that being said... well...   We started with a round of drinks. Since it was my firing party, I was ready for something nice and strong, so I went with Bubba's Blue Hawaiian: vodka, rum, gin, Blue Curacao, pineapple juice and Sierra Mist, yes, please, come to DADDY! The menu says $8.99, but don't be fooled! That doesn't include your collectible Bubba Gump glass, so you're more looking at $13. You have to specifically ask to NOT get the collectible glass, whereas I think it should be the other way around. But the drink was pretty good. Not quite an AMF, so it won't belt you on your ass, but not a totally tame drink either.  Dinner came around, and I have to say I was gravely disappointed with my dinner.  I got the Shrimper's Heaven, which along with french fries came with Fried Shrimp, "Chilly Shrimp," Coconut Shrimp, and Shrimp Tempura, along with three sauces: Asian, cocktail, and a Cajun sauce that reminded me more of orange marmalade.  I started with the "Chilly Shrimp," which I thought was just going to be cold shrimp like you might find in a shrimp cocktail. No, in fact, that is wrong. "Chilly Shrimp" is Bubba Gump's version of "Peel-n-Eat Shrimp," which means the shrimp is cooked inside its shell. Yes, shrimp have shells, and shrimp have legs, which took that portion of the dinner from "tasty seafood morsel" to "creature that used to be alive, probably leaving behind a family he supported and a shrimp company job that will have to do some PR work to explain his disappearance and he was probably named Charles." I can't eat things that could probably be named Charles. So there's a quarter of the dinner shot down.  The rest was tolerable. The coconut shrimp and fried shrimp were kind of dry, but the shrimp tempura was fine.  What wasn't fine was the bill: for JUST that and the drink, after gratuity I was paying $55 BY MYSELF. People, I just got fired! Just because I was paid out my vacation pay doesn't mean I need to be spending it all on dinner! I'll stick with Lazy Joe's for some good, affordable shrimp from now on.  I guess stupid really is as stupid does.

Ate at Bubba Gumps last night on the Strip.  Food was good enough but wait staff lacked enthusiasm and the elements of fun that I have experienced at other Bubba Gumps throughout the country.  I would try a different restaurant next time.

Clima familiar, boa decoracao com o tema do filme Forrest Gum, sempre uma excelente opção!! Não deixe de pedir o drink Coronita, maravilhoso! Os patros são frutos do mar e todos com camarões, vale muito a visita, além da loja no exterior para os aficionados em compras!

I wanted seafood so my bf who does not like seafood decides on this place.  I went in with an open mind but was sorely disappointed.  We ordered the app sampler and two other shrimp entrees.  The problem with all of the food was the shrimp seemed old or about to go bad.   The service was great no wait.  We walked through the door downstairs and as soon as the elevator door opened we were greeted by hostess with our table.  I still would not go again.

I wish I could review the food but since we could not get anyone to wait on us ( not even water ) I cannot. I will say that when I told the hostess others had been visited by their wait staff two and three times since we were seated she was unable to get anyone to take our table. I think we were in the middle the wait staff squabble and we were the recipients. Can we give a restaurant a negative number?
Yay i'm a fan is true. We were delighted to try this place was little taken back by the name didn't think the food would be great but it was. I am glad I loss the coin toss and ended up here.
Great view overlooking the strip way overpriced got two non alcoholic drinks a shrimp cocktail and a side Caesar salad and the bill was $37

We had no problem with the food or the service, the drink menu made it difficult for the server, I just wanted a draft beer, but there were no prices on the menu, the beer menu had the prices with the souvenir glass included with the beer, when I asked about the price without the take home souvenir, I was told if you want the 16 oz, take off $6.00, if you want the bigger beer take off $4.00 from the listed prices, why not make it easier and just have those prices on the menu. And a message to our server, it is not necessary to crouch down when taking our order, I worked in the industry and I am not a fan of that practice, you were not 7ft tall and we were not little people, just saying
The badest Bubba restaurant I were.  Dry and tasteless fish and shrimp were which too much lemon. The garlic bread was not crunchy. It was just soft.

I have wanted to try Bubba Gump for the last 4 years but just haven't. My husband and I finally did last night. It was great. We had the Forrest feast which is fried shrimp, fish, fries and hushpuppies. The hushpuppies were a little meh but everything else was pretty good. We will be back.

This place was just okay. We had a coupon for free appetizer and that's the only reason we went. We didn't have a choice of what appetizer we wanted and had to get the spinach dip which was the worst spinach dip I've ever had. My husband had the seafood feast and I had the shrimper's heaven. We spent about  $40 which was way too much considering the quality of the food and subpar service  The portions were decent but I probably won't go back.

Super disappointed and annoyed with Bubba's!!!! First off, I had to send 2 drinks back because the soft drink was just nasty, and my mixed drink was watered down and had no taste at all!! I ordered Bubba's After The Storm "bucket Of Boat Trash", and let me tell you, I should have put it in the trash because it was garbage!!! Why were there 2 COLD snow crab legs sitting on top of my hot shrimp, fish, and fries!?!?! The taste was not good! I'll be honest, I ate maybe half of it because we ended up paying almost $100 (including the tip) for 2 meals, 2 beers, and a soft drink!  I don't mind paying for some good food, but this... NOT!! Where are the annoyed emojis when you need them?! Ugghhh!! Oh, I had a Caesar salad too, it was OK. I can't even remember what my husband ordered... a bucket with steamed shrimp, corn, potatoes, and other veggies, but he said it was tasteless! Also a side of coconut shrimp, that was actually pretty good. The ONLY reason I gave this place 3 stars is because the of that shrimp and staff was very friendly and our waitress was awesome..thanks guys! Sadly, I left this place and still hours later pissed about the money we paid for what we got! UGGGGHH!!

The only reason I'm giving this 1 star is because the guy by the elevator was very friendly but we were there for 15 min before we walked out. No one helped us at all. People that sat down after us were helped before we walked out. Sucks because it was a place we were looking forward to eat at but because of this, we don't plan on returning.

The food here is pretty typical fried American food. It was exactly what we needed: filling and delicious. The service was a tad slow, and it didn't seem like there were a lot of people dining, but we weren't moving very quickly after a crazy Friday night out. My po'boy wasn't the most memorable of the foods I ate while in Vegas, but it was tasty and I was sad that I couldn't finish it all. One of my companions got a recovery burger and fries and she basically moaned the whole time, so I think it worked. My other companion got a shrimp and rice dish and I think she probably won best dish on the table.   It was a nice experience going to such a touristy-chain and just enjoying ourselves. But, if I could rate the view, this would be a solid 5. It was so awesome to be looking over the city and getting some fresh air fairly early in the day before the blistering heat took over. I'd probably come back here just for that.

It's a little hidden, so people seem to not notice it as well, so there was absolutely NO WAIT! It's a little bit of a hike up the many stairs, or you could use the elevator if you need (or are lazy). Service was quick, our glasses were never empty, and the food was fast and delicious. Our experience couldn't have been better.

I've tried and tried but I just don't know when I am going to learn my lesson to just stay away from chain seafood restaurants. Bubba Gumps is great for Forrest Gump memorabilia but not so great for the food.   The portions are small and very overpriced. I have been to numerous Bubba Gumps and they are all the same. No happy hour specials, no food specials, just an overall average dining experience.   I would not recommend Bubba Gumps if you are looking for good seafood, I would recommend it if you are looking to purchase Forrest Gump memorabilia.   I really really wanted to like this place which is why I have given it so many chances. But afyer going back 3 or 4 times it is safe to say three stars is being nice!   My recommendation is to find a real seafood place by the actual sea!

Good food but horrible service! They aren't attentive at all, once we sat waited 20 min and we had to ask for a waiter to get our drinks. For refills we also had to ask different servers that were passing by because our server wasn't really around, it seemed like they kept getting upset about us asking to be helped....
I had the stuffed shrimp and my mom had the New Orleans shrimp. Our meal was fabulous with a great view of the strip outside. Got the Raspberry smoothie and it was delightful! Great meal and service!
Definitely 10 starz! Who hoo! Always satisfied with the food and the servyis excellent!

OMG....THE worst ever. I came here because we went once  to the one inMaui Hawaii , I had the teriyaki burger best ever. Now we live in Las Vegas and I wanted to re-live the Maui experience. ....Well so said No teriyaki burger on menu NO shakes either. So I get the ribs with maui maui shrimp..So big and delicious on menu...actually very small dinner and as I write this I am waiting  for my dinner because ribs were Ice cold...wife had shrimp app just ok, and a root beer float they made special...she had to put my root beer in it cause it taste awfull....and son had pizza he's happy.....still no meal for me....wait..wait...wait...

I happened to find this place on its opening night in Vegas. The staff are exceptionally friendly, from the host at the front door to the bartender and other waitstaff. Felt right at home for this Mississippi-born girl. I ordered a bowl of the gumbo and was greeted by a wide bowl with two perfect mounds of rice surrounded by delicious sausage and shrimp gumbo. Spicy, but not too much for me. I also had a Delta Sunset margarita, which has a bit of a raspberry taste. Tasty! The drink is mixed right in front of you if you sit at the bar. There's great decor from old license plates, film stills from the movie Forrest Gump, and other reminders of Southern culture. Also, a gift shop on the lower level with elevator access to the restaurant for those who cannot walk up the stairs. Smiles all around!

Summary: Every time we visit Vegas we always walk by Bubba Gump but never stop in so for this trip my SO decided to drag me in. I like the setting, kind of remind me of Boiling Crab (http://www.yelp.com/biz/the-boiling-crab-garden-grove-2?osq=boiling+crab+restaurant) minus the sharpies on the wall.  Food: Base on yelp review, we decide to try their Hush Puppies first to see how it is before heading in to the main course. Luckily that is all we tried. The hush puppies was bland and very oily.   Service: 5 STARS for the staff members, from entrance to exit, the whole staff was cheerful and friendly.  Overall: We should have kept walking. We should have stick to, "hmm maybe one day we should try this place" and just never try it so it could stay mysterious. But we tried it. We didn't like it. End of story.

Ate at this location for the second time last night. This time we sat on the patio overlooking the Strip and City Center. Terrific view, perfect weather. Our server, Bobby?, was very friendly, attentive and helpful as well as being very knowledgeable with the menu. My wife wanted to upgrade part of her entree to crab legs and Bobby didn't know what the upcharge would be so he checked with the manager. In a few minutes the manager, Bud, came personally to let us know that the upcharge for that would bring the dish to almost $40 and asked if we she still wanted to upgrade it.  We thought it was very thoughtful and considerate of him to come over and let us know personally.
Came in and were immediately seated. Our food and drinks were awesome. We had the best server ever. She was bubbly and just plain awesome!!!  Love the decor and gift shop at the bottom.

Stopped here while on the strip because they had seating outside with a view of the strip! The view was nice. The food was delicious and very prompt! What made our visit even better was that our server Charles was awesome and attentive as well as friendly!! Overall we'll probably come back.

The food is bland, overpriced, and bad service (although our server was sweet) everyone else was rude. I ordered a chicken caesar salad, my husband ordered the shrimp scampi. I didn't taste his food after he said it tasted like the smell of Raid. The chicken in my salad was so bland I had to pour a bunch of salt in it. Not to mention it took them forever to bring out our food.

One of the best Movie themed restaurants I have ever visited.. The whole place is warm and welcoming.. The waitresses and staff are attentive and friendly.. We went for a quick lunch and the order was quick too! We ordered Cajun shrimp and Jambalaya.. Two awesomely awesome dishes! I would live to visit again! Kudos!

I had a great experience at this restaurant. The hostess gave us a warm welcome and we were seated almost immediately. We were seated outside at first for the view of the strip. However, it was a little too humid so we asked to move inside and was moved immediately.   The server was very friendly and attentive, she came to our table in less than two minutes after we sat. She gave us time to place our orders and was very thorough in Describing what to expect from the dishes.   Our food was served in a timely manner, however in between our food being served the waitress made sure we were comfortable. Our food was exactly as she described. I ordered the shrimp and chicken jambalaya, it was awesome! If you like spicy food I definitely recommend. My mom ordered a shrimp dish that she enjoyed. However my sister ordered the lobster salad; the lobster was overcooked. The manager immediately took it off the bill when he learned that she was not satisfied with her food.  Overall I had a great experience here. Nice family restaurant while in Vegas, I never fail to be amazed by the Forrest Gump memorabilia!

Over priced and food was average.  I ordered the special which had broiled tilapia, grilled shrimp (Cajun), and shrimpy mac and cheese.  The mac and cheese was ok but they could have kept the bread crumbs.  My daughter got the crab legs which was probably the best meal at the table.  My mom and friend got the fried shrimp and fish and they said it was just ok.  Well the bright side is that I can now say we tried it.  Will not return.

Best hush puppies I've ever had. High price for the food but the atmosphere is fun and the entire staff was very friendly. Had a large group 10+ and they got us in less that 10 min on a Friday afternoon.  Like that they treated the kids like a fun addition to the group rather than ignoring them and only speaking to the adults.
I will never come here again. Six people at dinner and not ONE person liked their food!!! Save your money and go someplace different!

I love seafood but I'm usually not a fan of chained restaurants.  This place was good. I had the shrimp scampi.  It was a big portion so I saved some for breakfast.  We also had some type of soup with shrimp, very delicious also.

Came here after getting in late on a delayed flight. Talk about somebody being hungry. My friend wanted seafood and Bubba Gump Shrimp takes their last guest at 10 pm. So it was late when we went around 8:30-ish pm. Patrick our server was very nice and informative. I ordered the gumbo which was very good but has a nice spicy kick to it. Next, I ordered the coconut shrimp meal. Shrimp was very good, but honestly, I was full off the gumbo. So most of the shrimp back to the room with me. The leftover shrimp made for a good breakfast the next day.

My friends and I came here on a wimp and ordered based on the pictures. The strawberry chicken pecan salad was extremely delicious and I'm not a vegetable type of person. Server was very kind and helpful as well. Definitely a must go if you're on the strip!

Well, it's worth a try considering it's Bubba Gumps.    The service was quick and friendly.  Sometimes too friendly.  We were quite hungry and quiet at our table so the nice waitress decided to come over and distract us by doing a Bubba Gump movie trivia.  Nice, but weird and could have done without.  We are anti-social.. LOL  Now, the place and the food.  If you have ever been to the Joe's Crab Shack chain, this place looks and feels exactly like it without all the crab options.  Ordered the shrimp New Orleans which was okay but nothing special.  The hubs garlic shrimp were tasty, kinda small in my opinion.  Overall, the experience was decent however I would not go out of my way to try it again.    The End
Went during lunch so it wasn't crowded at all. The food was fresh but the service was slow and terrible.

I love SHRIMP! ok... I love food in general.   Food was great! But trying to get service here, was like trying to find the right pair of pants (nearly impossible or quick).   Our table literally asked for a sharp knife to TWO servers. Let's just say, by the time we got the knife, we didn't need it. (I hope you stub your toe servers!)
Thank you for giving me and my wife a nice time out in town. I have nothing bad to say. The food was good and sitting on the balcony watching people get crazy in Las Vegas was awesome. Thank you.

Came here last week for dinner. Came in through downstairs where we were greeted and the staff radioed upstairs to expect us. Was seated promptly and given instructions about the Forrest Gump licence plate signs for service. Cool touch I must add. More restaurants should implement something similar imho.  Flipped the sign to Stop Forrest Stop when ready to order and a server was with us within a minute. Ordered the Shrimper's Net Catch with half garlic and half Cajun. I personally preferred the garlic. I thought the Cajun was too saucy, but thankfully it wasn't too spicy.   Also had Forrest's Surf and Turf as my main. It comes with a 9oz tenderloin, shrimp, mashed potatoes, and onions. It was food a plenty for me. The shrimps were my favourite in this meal. The meal wasn't 5 star spectacular, but it was a solid 4 in terms of taste and value.  Service is definitely top notch here with a casual atmosphere. Servers are prompt and kept us up to date with the orders. To top it off, depending on what beverage you order, you can also take home a glass or shaker! Overall the food was 4 out of 5, but the service definitely bumps it up for the extra star! Definitely recommended if you want a decent meal in a casual setting with great service!

Ok this review is based on dining by the bar and on one meal.  One meal we have each year and have tried at most Gump Restaurants in the US: the netcatch with Cajun and garlic.  There is only one way to have that dish- with garlic bread on the side. Peel em and layer them carefully on the bread.  Then dig in. It is the only way as I said and it is the Monica and Jonni way!   The waiter we had saw us doing this last year,  and he has adopted our style too! We met him this year too.   And those shrimps taste wonderfully. My favorite is garlic but always need a tasting of both.  So- two netcatch and garlic bread alla Monica and Jonni,  please!

Had this restaurant bookmarked for some time now so we finally tried it for dinner last night.  Location - great view, but horrible to get to.  It is quite a far walk no matter where you are coming from.  You can either park in the garage in Miracle Mile shops, park across the street at Harley Davidson cafe (for a small price), or park at the Cosmopolitan and walk across the bridge.  The views, if you are sitting outdoors, is awesome!  The location is overlooking right in the middle of Harmon and LV blvd. which has the views of City Center and The Cosmopolitan.  Restaurant - Forrest Gump themed.  If you are a fan of the movie, you will appreciate the memorabilia all over the walls.  First floor is the retail area, Second floor is the actual restaurant.  Food - Overly priced small portions type of meals (what one should expect of a strip restaurant).  My boyfriend ordered 2 of what our server recommended which was the Georgia Sweet Tea (alcoholic drink) and the Shrimp New Orleans.  I ordered Lt. Dan's Drunken Shrimp.  I loved the sweet tea drink (again, it was a steep price for a small drink).  I didn't care for the sauce on the Shrimp New Orleans dish (even though the server raved about it).  All that matters is my boyfriend liked it.  The Lt. Dan's Drunken Shrimp dish was nothing out of the ordinary.  It was shrimp, sausage, mashed potatoes which shoestring chips on top.  I probably could have made this myself if I made the effort to.  Staff - friendly and attentive, but then again the restaurant wasn't that busy yet.  We did get a free glass at the end of our meal.  I didn't really catch the reason why, but I think it's because of the drink we ordered.  Honestly, I don't know if I can recommend this place mainly because of the price.  But if you are like me who has to try it just to say you tried it, live the experience..!

Every time we are in Vegas we make a stop here for lunch. We always get the shrimp New Orleans. This time we also had the calamari and some drinks.   The shrimp New Orleans has this sauce that is out of bounds. It comes with a crazy amount of shrimp and is with every penny.   Service is great here. They have these signs you flip when you need service so it speeds up your experience and gets you back out quickly to enjoy Vegas/ or your travels.

Alabama Steam Pot - this is unbelievably delicious and fresh, thanks. And the spot is of course really good and fun both for adult companies and families. Will return for sure. And of course: Patrick - good job man, decent service.

This restaurant was awesome! The host gave us a seat right away. Our waiter Colin was very talkative and informative about the menu. He got us our drinks and appetizers very fast. I got the strawberry frozen lemonade and it tasted great especially knowing I could keep the light up cup! I also ordered the shrimp scampi and it was delicious.    This was a great place to come with the family. It was very quiet compared to other restaurants on the strip. Overalls great food, friendly waiters and great atmosphere!  Definitely recommend coming here with your family!

We were nearby and decided to try out Bubba Gump's for dinner.    The dining area is located one level up from the entrance filled with memorabilia and gift items.  We were luckily seated in Chad's section for our meal.   He definitely provided great service throughout the evening.  He was fun and very friendly.    We started off with the Seafood hush pups that are filled with shrimp and fish.  Since we love hush puppies, this was right up our alley.   Very good with the remoulade dipping sauce.  For my entree I chose Jenny's catch.  This was seared tilapia over mashed potatoes and sautéed spinach covered with a lobster butter sauce.   Sounds good right? But it really lacked flavor.  The sauce was very mediocre.      I tried my husbands meal which was Lt. Dan's Drunken Shrimp.  This was lots of shrimp mixed in with andouille sausage in a bourbon sauce.  This was fantastic.  Spicy and so delicious!  If it wasn't for Chad, this would probably be rated 3 stars.  But I was so impressed with the service and most of our food, I had to go with 4.  If you are in the area...  try it out!

Delicious!!! Wow what an experience for a shrimp shack.  The food was awesome and fresh, had the shrimp spectacular and it was.  The waiter was super friendly and had a great personality made you feel welcome.    Really like the idea of flipping sign to show you are ready for stop or go.  Really good cocktails and you get a fee glass with purchase, it is a new one from the store:)   Atmosphere and noise level were perfect lots and lots if Forrest Gump memorabilia on the was and slogans.    Recommend to everyone who loves shrimp.

I've been to this particular restaurant before, and enjoyed it. This time was no exception. The hosting staff quickly and easily sat us at a wheelchair accessible table.  Our server, Rafi, was an absolute delight and fun. She and her team were attentive without being obtrusive, and her playful banter just added to a very enjoyable late lunch.   We look forward to coming again soon.

Went here once with the family. The food is really good and we love the atmosphere. It can be busy sometimes. Also the waiters are really cool. They even quiz you questions from the movie which is really neat. It was a hard place to find though we got lost and had to ask people how to get there. Also the meals aren't cheap. My meal and my wifes meal were $20 each. Not bad but not a place we'd go to more than once a year.

We had a party of 33, so I called ahead of time. The person I spoke to on the phone didn't seemed too thrilled about a large party coming in. I was a little worried about that because we have been to restaurants where service was horrible because of large parties. However when we got there, everyone was really friendly. Our waiter we got on our end of the table provided excellent customer service. The lady I had spoke to on the phone stated that everyone on the same bill must sit together. Our waiter allowed for our kids to move around and said he will work with whatever we decide to do. He went above and beyond! The food was excellent as well! We enjoyed this location the best (we've been to three locations in California)

We went here for dinner as the sun was setting. We sat outside against the rail and had a pretty decent view of the strip as the lights were just starting to come on. I got the delicious shrimp heaven dish and I must of gotten and 30 shrimp (coconut, fried, tempura battered, shrimp cocktail, and fries)  I especially loved the coconut shrimp. We ordered the lava flow drinks in fun light up glasses which made for some fun pictures. Very good drinks, but way overpriced. The waitress even asked us some Forest Gump Trivia which just added to the experience. It's right next to the balcony of the goretorium bar and we saw some zombies taking a smoke break! Great time!
I love EVERYTHING in this RESTRO esp the bread pudding .. I love to sit outside looking through out the Strip .. KIds Love this place as well ... Everything in the menu is awesome with good price

This place is funny. Went here with some friends for the first time, and let me tell you, the stop and go signs on each table is fun to use. We were seated in like 2 minutes during lunch time. They were a little under staffed that day so we had like 3-4 waiters. No biggy. Pricing was reasonable. We ordered our food with no problem and it arrived in a average time period. Everybody was satisfied with the tasty food. It's a little above average seafood. I say this because clearly I've been to a few top seafood restaurants where the seafood is absolutely and freshly define. But I'll come here before I go to Red Lobster.

First time here. Loved it! Kids had fun and loved their food. Courtney was AMAZING.. she was great with the kids and made sure our table with 5 kids had everything we needed.  Adults had a great time and loved their food too.

I just have to say that I have been a big Bubba Gump Shrimp Co fan since the restaurant first started in Monterey, CA.  I have been to locations all over the country, including Hawaii and I have only had one tiny food complaint once in all of those visits  I am so glad they finally have a Las Vegas, NV location and right on the strip is perfect!  I wrote Bubba Gump on their corporate website once a year for five + years begging them to come to Las Vegas....right after they do, I move away LOL!  I guess I better get letter writing again to get them to come to the North West ;)  I just LOVE LOVE everything about the restaurant!!  The food is always great!  The only problem I had this time is that I ordered too much food!!  I will be back over and over!!!!

We had the best experience at Bubba Gump Shrimp Co.  Greeted by a smiling hostess and seated immediately.  Try the BBQ shrimp with potatoes and veggies.  The pop corn shrimp has jalapenos it without the seeds.  Well...there was a few seeds, which is fine by me!  Everything was beyond my expectations.  The shrimp has just enough Zest and spice. to make me want to return here, the next time I'm in Vegas!  Just like Bubba said it would be.  Plus the price is RIGHT!
Fun place - fun vibe. Lots of memorabilia to notice! Also the service was friendly and a thumbs up.   I really wanted good shrimp out of this place but sadly the food was so-so.

Great location in the strip. Very nice food and drink menu. Fantastic dinner for both taste and size. They have a patio with a nice strip view. Well worth the wait and beats the heck out of a buffet      Wait staff was friendly, knowledgable  and  attentive. I would go back.

If you like fried seafood and Forrest Gump Trivia then this place is for you. We ordered a seafood platter, which included fried shrimp, fish, fries, calamari and different sauces.  My gf opted to order grilled shrimp entrée. The food was ok, nothing to write home about. The shrimp seemed frozen and the fish had no flavor. The batter used for the fried food was ok. The French fries were bit stale too.   I did score some good points on the Forrest Gump trivia. Overall it's an ok restaurant, given the choices for restaurants on the strip, I'd skip this one.

We have been here a few times for food and beer. The service here has been consistently good, especially for a tourist strip place. The beer selection could be a bit broader but is satisfactory. We have tried several items on the menu, my wife likes the hush puppies, and everything has been good each time, again unusual for the casual dining places on the strip.

I read another review about this place, and went in with some friends. My guy ordered the fish and chips and it was absolutely the bomb. We walked around the strip with this place on the mind. So we came back and order more shrimp, fish and andouille sausage.

It was our first time in Vegas, and we accidentally stumbled over this place. We did not have any idea about its food offering and how it rated with the gastronomic crowd. I'd say it was a pleasant experience for my group. Their clam chowder was good! I also liked their mahi mahi. More than anything else, our waitress named Amanda was simply amazing. I would recommend this place.

At one time I really likes it here.  Now it's ok.. Very expensive for what you get.  The service was good and the food hit.  I had a salad and shared the popcorn shrimp with my grandson.   He also had a cup of the clam chowder.  It was very good.   I gave it an extra star for the atmosphere.  On par with Applebee's, Red Robin, etc..  Only way more expensive.  It was also clean.
OK Just We had a very mediocre meal, maybe we expected too much! Staff friendly. Unfortunately would not be returning! June 2016
Very unique place themed from the Forest Gump movie. It's big and you get a great view of the strip if you sit outside. The food is surprisingly good and the fish and chips are highly recommended.

Every time I travel and there happens to be a Bubba Gump's in that city I make sure to stop in and have my favorite peel n' eat shrimp appetizer.  It was as yummy as I remembered it.  Our server Patrick was so nice and accommodating.  Due to my friend's allergies Patrick was very thoughtful and gave us alternative options.  We really appreciate him going above and beyond.  His service was prompt and seamless.    The manager Patrick also stopped by to check on us.  We always appreciate it when managers show that they care.   I highly recommend this location!  We will surely be back soon!

I stopped by this relatively new place on The Strip today after lunch because I had a business meeting nearby. I was shocked at how the interior space is utilized so well on The Strip in this location at the corner of Harmon Avenue. The entire place conveys a fun and engaging theme.   The view of The Strip from the outdoor balcony is sufficiently impressive to warrant your dining or drinking here just for that experience.  I had New Orleans Shrimp and a dark beer I'd never heard of with a marketing nightmare of a name, Moose Drool Brown Ale. Turns out the beer is excellent in spite of the crazy name, and I will order it again.   And oh yes, the New Orleans Shrimp was delicious and, to be honest, this dish exceeded my expectations because of the seasoning and presentation. This place comes across as well conceived and executed with smart management and an excellent staff.

Seafood is pretty fresh.  Food here is just as delicious as the one in the bay area. Drinks are yummy and with enough alcohol.  The thing that I loved the best was that we were able to keep the cool glasses that our drinks came in.  They were replaced by brand new ones of course.  Service was very good as well.

We had two very good meals here.  Yes it is a Landry's chain and as you would expect chain restaurant food but its still good.  We had one rather rude server the first night but everyone else was outstanding.   The bucket of Boat Trash with crab clusters, shrimp and fish with cajun seasoning was amazing..  Nothing tasted fishy.  Service was fast and the food came out hot.  Only other glitch was food runners brought out the food and apparently did not look at the ticket as we had to ask our waiter about my meal but he got it for us right away and it was still hot and fresh.
Friendly service. Fresh salads. Reasonably priced also. The pear berry salad had awesome raspberry dressing and the coconut shrimp are really good.

Came here late night after the McGregor and Diaz fight (3/5/16) with my husband. We were starving and it was our first time being on the Strip in Vegas. We love sea food so we decided to try Bubba Gumps. I ordered the Shrimpers Net Catch getting half Cajun and half garlic spice with a side of fries. I wasn't a fan of the Cajun spice but loved the Garlic spice. My husband and I LOVED the fries. He ordered the Shimp Macaroni and didn't like it. He also order Clam chowder and loved it. The service was awesome. We came back the next day (3/6/16) with our inlaws and kids and had our last meal in Vegas at Bubba Gumps then headed back on the road to SoCal. My daughter at all her pasta, some of my shrimp and everyone loved their food. Service was awesome as well.

If 0 stars would be available that's what I would give. This place had the worst service ever! We arrived late night and the place was empty. Our server took our order and never came back in to check on us. After 45 mins we decided to ask about our meal and they told us it was normal to wait a while. Shortly after our waitress comes to our table and states she doesn't know what happened to our order so she's going to place it again and asks what we're having. She didn't empathize or say she was sorry. We literally stood up. On the way out I saw another employee and asked to speak to their boss and she stated she wasn't sure where the manager was at. Do not recommend this place if you're looking to feel welcomed and appreciated as a customer.

Love it, came here to grab lunch with my boss.  Both got the seafood feast. The fish and chips portion was my favorite along with just the breaded shrimp.  Service is great, the girls that served my boss and I were very sweet and nice.  My only con is that i did not enjoy the fries too much.

After watching Forrest Gump and loving the movie, I had to try bubba gumps shrimping co. When I saw it on the strip I HAD to go there. This place is the bomb! Their shrimp shack pasta is my favorite dish; it has tangy, buttery sauce over a bed of penne, tomatoes, and shrimp. The workers also play Forrest Gump trivia with you. It's quite amusing! If you get all the questions right, you get some sort of prize. When I went to the one in San Francisco, they gave us free parking.  I live in Seattle, I wish I could take this place back home with me. It's a bit pricey, but you get what you pay for!

Tonight's visit was a 10+ our server Jessie L was definitely on it he checked on us so many times during the meal I almost offered him a seat at the table. Waters and drinks were refilled quickly. The food came quick and everything was prepared perfect. Without a doubt one of the best dining experiences I've ever had at Bubba Gump.

If you are craving seafood in Vegas, you will not be disappointed at Bubba Gump Shrimp. Even in the middle of a desert, the atmosphere? makes you feel like you are near a body of water with the typical seafood decorations - hardwood floor, wooden walls, rustic decorations, big windows, and mismatched seats. There are a lot of positive vibes with the friendly? staff and delicious food.   I first had the jambalaya, which had chicken, shrimp, andouille sausage, bell pepper, onions, rice, green onions, tomatoes, and a decently spicy sauce. The jambalaya? was a savory dish, full of flavor and filled with tender meat.   I also had the shrimp scampi, which had shrimp (of course), capers, and linguine (duh). This dish was rich and zesty with the lemon garlic butter that covers it. The shrimp was tender and good in size. It also went very well with the garlic bread that came on the side. You definitely? cannot go wrong with the shrimp scampi here.   Additionally, I like how you can flip a sign indicating whether you need a waiter or you would like to be left alone. The sign worked well in the beginning, but towards the end of my dinner, it did not seem to do any good with getting help when needed. Maybe this was a one time deal, but it was still disappointing?. Now, the server did apologize when my table received? the check; ?so, I am appreciative? of that.   Overall, a spectacular atmosphere with tasty food.

First let me say shrimp is everything baby !!! Came here for lunch I had the "I'm stuffed!" Shrimp which was large shrimp, crab stuffing, jasmine rice with garlic butter topped with Monterey Jack cheese and my best friend had the "Shrimpers Heaven" which was coconut shrimp, chilly shrimp, fried shrimp and Japanese style tempura shrimp all with fries and dipping sauces. Let me just say they totally delivered we shared our meal and everything tastes good!!! Since it was our first time there the sign system was one of the first things we learned and it totally was the best thing as far as getting your servers attention or any server at all. Dominick was our server and he was the best! He even shared a convo with us about Vegas and living out there and different things about the city. He was a really nice guy and he loved the Patriots so that was a bonus since we were from Boston. They service and food were definitely 5 stars!

I love Bubba Gump's! I'm originally from California so when I saw that they were opening a location here in Las Vegas, I was stoked. I finally visited over the weekend and my first visit to this location was great! At first we sat down at a table in the inside but we had been walking around prior to coming in so we felt too warm, we asked if we could be moved outside and without any hesitation, they said yes! The view is gorgeous from outside! All our food was delicious, I got Lt. Dan's Drunken Shrimp, it was seasoned just right! On the plus, I got a free Shaker with my drink purchase! I highly recommend them, our server was very attentive and everyone was friendly as well.

They don't make the clam chowder in the house anymore but the gumbo was made in house and it's quite delicious as always the coconut shrimp as always my favorite. Because the clam chowder is not made in house anymore I give it a four star rating but my coconut shrimp and the great service were provided really deserve a five.
Lots of fun , everyone is Friendly, Stephen our server was great. Food is good, fast . Atmosphere lively and upbeat . Lots of young people. Definitely will come again .

Terrible. Terrible. Terrible.   My friends and I went here on our first night in Vegas and were starved for just about anything. We got seated quickly, which was nice but that was probably the only pleasant part of this dining experience.   My friend is on a pretty strict diet and asked if a certain dish could be made without butter, the server said she would go and ask and that was the last we saw of her. The next thing we know the runners were bringing us our food and the dish that she asked for without butter looked like it was drenched in it. We asked if we could ask the manager or anyone if there was butter on it and it took about 30 minutes before we got any kind of answer.  Finally, the manager came over and assured us it wasn't so she began to eat it. About 10 minutes later she came back and said it actually was made with butter.  By this time everyone else was done with their meals. All in all it was a headache of an experience and was handled terribly by the staff.

We had so much fun here tonight.  There was no line and we were served promptly.  Bryant S was our server and he was like a character straight out of the movie.  He really made our night.  The food was fantastic.

The view outside is cool, but overall im not really impressed with this place. I just had a grilled chicken sandwhich. The lobster mac in cheese my friend got was sent back. She probably couldve added salt and been fine, but as is it's pretty bland. Their drinks are decent though. Get the one that comes with the souvenior cup. It's pretty strong.

The bf and I were craving seafood on our last night in Vegas. Walking around the Miracle Mile shops, all the restaurants wanted to charge an obscene amount for seafood. In the end we found ourselves at Bubba Gump-- seafood craving satisfied, no wait time, wallet happy, and definitely buzzed.  I have to say Carlos really deserves this review. He was a great server, honest and to the point. For people like me who've never been to Bubba Gump, their menu is extensive and therefore a bit overwhelming. Carlos made some good suggestions based on customer favorites, as well as help us make a decision of Gumbo vs. Jambalaya. We went with the jambalaya. Best. Decision. Ever.  FOOD: - Deep Fried Calamari w/ Red Bell Peppers and Pepperoncinis. Served with Dippin' Sauces. ($10.29) : The Calamari was good. Could do without the additional veggies, and they need to give more tartar sauce! [3.5/5]  - Jambalaya (Blackened Chicken, Shrimp and Andouille Sausage, sautéed with Bell Pepper, Onions, and Rice in Bubba's own Spicy Sauce. Topped with Tomatoes and Green Onions. $17.99): The portion is deceptively a fair amount. Initially we thought it was a bit small on the platter, but even my hungry boyfriend couldn't finish it. And it made the best drunken munchies later that night. The rice was spicy and creamy, all it needed was some baby scallops! [4.7/5]  -Jenny's Catch with Lobster Butter Sauce (Pan seared Tilapia laid over Mashed Potatoes with sautéed Spinach and a creamy Lobster Butter Sauce. 19.99) : SO GOOD. The fish was cooked beautifully and not overcooked like in most restaurants. There were two good sized fillets served with this dish. My only complaint was the mashed potatoes were a bit lukewarm/cold. The lobster butter sauce was fantastic. [4.5/5]  Trust me, if you're looking for seafood this place has it at the best prices (unless you're doing buffets). The restaurants in the Miracle Mile Shops next door in Planet Hollywood were charging anywhere from $28-$50 for seafood, not to mention tiny portions.  If I'm ever in Vegas and craving seafood, I'll be back.

Chains aren't my favorite travel experience, but my SO lives Forrest Gump. The food is always good, not life changing, but reliably decent. Our service in Vegas was perfect, the food was fast, and the decor keeps fans amused.

I had higher expectations but it wasn't that bad. If you're looking for something affordable that's along the lines of an Applebee's or TGIF's then this is the place, especially in it's prime location in planet Hollywood. The view is great. And the servers are enthusiastically perky.   Clam chowder: not the usual creamy version but more of a thin stew. It was okay but just wasn't expected.  Forrest's Seafood Feast: A good amount as a sampler. Fries are decent, fish and chips were overly battered, fried shrimp was okay but the hush pups were good. Not the usual corn breaded hush puppies.

Should have known better and to eat at a bad chain when surrounded by all the great restaurants on the strip. Food basically had no flavor and was over cooked. I didn't even finish half of the plate. Server we had was a very nice guy and they all seemed to be working hard and trying to satisfy customers. Not sure what the issue is with the food but do your self a favor and if you go, know the history of the Tom Hanks movie so you can answer questions in their trivia. Just order drinks as they were good.

I have been to Bubba Gump a few times in other states and have always been pleased. This visit was the same. We had a long day of travel and preferred a casual meal over the Vegas glitz.  We wanted seafood, so even though we don't typically do chains we gave it a try. The food was really good. I had Mahi with vegetables and rice.  I was hungry and it hit the spot. The wait staff was fun as usual. They were efficient and friendly. One of my favorite things about this place is the Forest Gump Trivia. So if you are going brush up on your movie knowledge. The prices for food is what is expected in Vegas, really not too bad. Located on The Strip about midway down makes it an easy stop in if you are out walking.
The food was good and our server was too funny. Great attitude and even played Bubba Gump trivia with us. Kind of pricey for a $$ place but we will go back some day.

If you love shrimp you have to come to bubba Gump it is tender the calamri isn't chewy the seasoning is perfect and dipping sauce to die for all the flavors work so well together and service is awesome had the shriper's heaven and for appetizer the fried calamari and popcorn shrimp spices are great and the coconut shrimp red lobster could definitely learn a thing or two a must go when I come back to Vegas again

Ugh! What can I say? Out of all of the eateries in Vegas we ended up here. Save your money, save your time. Nothing to write home about..... one of my guests had to send her entire entree back. Why? ICE COLD! Another member in my party wondered why her gumbo was warm on one end of the bowl and cold on another. I ordered an appetizer and was presented with an entree ($8 additional dollars). Overall, the experience was not the greatest. No rush to return.

On my most recent trip here, the food was good and the same as usual, but it was the service and management that really pissed us off and now I don't know if we will ever return...at least to this location.   Our server was alright. There was a couple times where we couldn't find her but I'm thinking they were just understaffed that evening; it was during the holidays after all. When we were done with our meal, she seemed a little pushy on getting us to buy desserts even when we told her we were way too full and just wanted the check. She asked us to think about it and she'd come back. What the heck? Why can't you just bring the check? It seemed like she wanted us to give a definite answer of no before she was willing to print the check. Strike one.  When we finally received the check, we attempted to pay with an e-gift card that had $100 loaded on it and our meal was $91 including tax. When she brought the receipt for us to sign, she told us that we couldn't tip with the gift card and that we still had $8 or $9 remaining on the card, awesome...where's the gift card, could we have it back? The server refused and told us it was policy to keep our printed gift cards whether or not there was a remaining balance. WHAT? How does that even make sense? I will never be able to use the remaining balance then! We asked her to make a copy for us but she refused and told us to simply re-print one when we got home...problem is how do you do that when it was a gift and I already deleted the original e-mail?! No other business I've frequented has ever asked to keep a gift card, remaining balance or not without asking first if I wanted it back. She told me this is what her manager told her to do, which didn't really help the situation. I considered not leaving a tip since I just lost 9 bucks but ended up leaving a decent one and decided to take it up with management at a later date since it wasn't her fault and she was just doing what she was instructed to do.  I e-mailed the company about a week later and complained about my remaining balance that was lost because I was unable to get my gift card back and 2 days later received a phone call from one of the managers of the Vegas location. She stated that it was company policy to do this and the server indeed followed protocol. I was really angry and got in a heated argument with the manager about the policy since it doesn't really protect them from anything, while making it super inconvenient for customers and discourages them from buying and using gift cards. It wasn't the 9 bucks that I cared about, but the principle of what was going on that seemed fraudulent to me. I got nowhere with management and she continued to tell me that it was corporate policy. Ok, I guess I'll have to contact them to get more info then.  Then we contacted corporate customer service and was told that this was NOT corporate/company policy in any way, shape or form and that the store was mistaken and they weren't sure why. They ended up sending us a new link to re-print our gift card with the remaining balance and informed us that we would be receiving a phone call apology from the General Manager once they contacted him about the situation.  All in all, Bubba Gump Las Vegas is run by liars and they did nothing but inconvenience my family and then lie to me about it to back up their side of the story. It will take a lot for me to come back here in the furture, if I ever do. Just thinking about it gets me fired up and angry. I really hope they go out of business some day when this all catches up to them!
