UPDATE (2/12/14): Well, it's been over a month and still haven't heard from the General Manager of Bubba Gump or received the apology I was promised. Worst customer service of any restaurant chain I've been to! Would never recommend this place to anyone
Excellent food, quick and friendly service! Those combinations always make for a great lunch stop.

I had the worst experience ever at this place!!!!! Service was horrible and the food was not great to make up for it either. I heard soooooo much about bubba gump shrimp and was always really excited to try it, and finally a group of friends and I did. Sadly the server we had was AWFUL!!!!!!!!! I had never in my life seen anyone hate his "life/job" more than our server, he was talking to us like we were "annoying him" for just being there it was ridicules. He would cut us off in the middle of ordering, and talk to the other waiters around him, and when we asked for recommendations he just simply told us "that it all depends on what you like" in the tone of voice saying (just pick darn it!).  The food was not great and the portions were SMALLER than expected but the service did not help, it made us just want to get out of there, without even getting a dessert (this pretty much never happens in my book so its serious! lol)  and when we finally got the bill he asked us to pick up everything off the table put it in the plates and pick it up and hand it to him, (if you ask me, he pretty much made us clear our own table for him! lol and we tipped him after! haha) overall horrible experience but gave for conversation at dinner and after! lol

Amazing time!! Service was great. I don't remember our servers name, but he was so courteous and personable. He asked my friends and I trivia questions about the movie while we waited on our food. That definitely helped the time pass. Which wasn't long, because the kitchen was very fast. When the food did arrive, we didn't talk AT ALL. The seafood gumbo was melt-in-your-mouth delicious!! I was just very curious as to why there are no pictures of Bubba in the areas of the restaurant that caught my visual field (and I saw the whole place).

The patio was so nice on a beautiful day! The service was great as were the drinks! They will have a couple on special each day. We just had a snack of shrimp (half cajun, half regular (I think soaked in beer)  DELICIOUS and not too busy for a late lunch. Everything was clean, even the washroom. Ya, it is a chain but an interesting one, I recommend it. You will know what amazing shrimp cookery smells like as you climb the stairs to the bar area!

Pricing wasn't bad at all for a strip side seat watching above the blvd. Shrimp (of course) was great, Sampled all of them (I think)...Good mixed drinks, with a lot of their creations. On the sweet side, but alcohol that tastes like candy is really good when you've been drinking ETOH like H2O...Calamari was unique with fried peppers, jalapeno, and some other stuff in it. Super service, great ambience, and everything was a la Forrest Gump...Fun place that wont brake ya!
Excited to finish my trip to Vegas on of my favorites restaurants but it was below my expectations. So so service with a so so food...

This is more about their corporate side of things... First of all, they don't follow through with what they say. They had called me but I wasn't able to take their call since I was in the shower but they said they would call back in 30 mins... It's now been a week! So I see that this particular corporation doesn't care about what customers really think as long their pockets and wallets stay full. Anyone that knows me knows that the cost of food isn't an issue but more of the quality/quantity of what I'm paying for and in this case I received neither. If I'm going to pay $20+ for a "feast" I expect to get what I pay for. I'm sure they could really care less whether I ever go back to anyone of their establishments since I'm only one person but I won't take one step on their sidewalk. Thanks for your "professionalism" Bubba Gump Shrimp...

Came in here for the very first time after seeing some good reviews but I was sadly disappointed. We ordered jumbo shrimp appetizer, soup salad a bucket of fries.  The shrimp was overcooked and gummy no flavor . When I asked the server is that generally how they cook shrimp she seemed a little confused and told me she actually never ate there which was a little odd . We had it boxed and gave to homeless guy won't be surprise if he toss it in the trash . It was not worth what we paid for and it will be my last time there .

Stopped in for lunch today. Tried the Shrimp New Orleans dish. The food was very tasty, but it was our server, Keisha, that made the experience a step above great. She was very patient with us while we were trying to decide what to order for our drinks and entrees. She made some suggestions that were really helpful. Keisha, keep up the good work ! In the words of the Terminator,  I'LL BE BACK !!

We all know how amazing the food is at BubbaGump Shrimp is but I think one of the best things they do at this restraunt is they have a sign. If you need something for the table you put up the stop first sign and any off the waiters near by will stop and help you. It doesn't just have to be your waiter. Is wonderful to get fast and friendly service when you go.

First time for me and my dining partner. No waiting for a table at 6 pm on a Tuesday evening. Service was prompt and the waitress was patient with our orders. She offered a few drink suggestions to my partner, one of which was taken. Turned out to be a good choice. We both had the gumbo shrimp soup and shared an cheese dip with shrimp as an appetizer. The dip was very good with lots of shrimp pieces. The soup was appropriately spicy and filling. A good meal for $63.

First time eating at this franchise.  In town on vacation and friends recommended. I can see why they wanted us to stop. If you love shrimp this is the place to go. So many options to choose from that it is hard to nail it down.  We were able to sit outside and enjoy the Vegas Strip. The drinks are a little spendy but unique and you get to keep the souvenir glass. The waiter was friendly and even offered trivia questions about the Forest Gump movie. Would gladly stop at another location.

We went here to sit on the balcony over looking the strip. It has a great view!  The food is ok.. The hush puppies are the best I've had. Bubba Gumps is a fun experience but way over priced..We split an appetizer, meal, dessert and 2 beers for $75! It was worth it for the view. I wouldn't go there if you're on a tight budget.
Get the spicy jambalaya! And shrimp Mac and Cheese! Melt in your mouth delish!

Being in Vegas most of us carry around a big slushie drink (mine from Fat Tuesdays) & most restaurants knowing this willingly accommodate you bringing your drinks into their establishment so you can enjoy a meal. They realize you can't pound back a yard long alcoholic drink so quickly. Well upon entering this restaurant I was told I needed to finish my 3/4 full drink or I couldn't enter. I haven't had this problem with any restaurant on the vegas strip. I'm sorry I won't order your $6 drink but would rather order your $25 entreé. Will never return to any of their restaurants due to the way this was handled. I was told to finish my drink before they closed in an hour & would be served then. Well my drunk self would probably not want to eat at that point. Off to La Salsa Cantina we went in Planet Hollywood where we received amazing service!

Had Shandi as our server and  she was great! We did the trivia game which was actually fun. We never went without drinks and our food was actually really delicious. I got my usual Shrimp New Orleans and the spice to it was perfect.   We got a chance to talk with one of the managers. His name was Matt. He was very personable and gave us great tips for shows and places to get massages. Overall we enjoyed our visit!

Welcome to Vegas Bubba! This now means 2 things, I can no longer eat you in Cali, because it's against the rules being that you're an official Vegas restaurant now. Second, you decorated well, but maybe you should have stayed in Cali. I liked you better there.  I was super hyped up when I heard the news that my city was getting a Bubba Gump. I have dined at both the Santa Monica and Anaheim locations in the past and always loved it. Fried Chicken, shrimp bloody marys, and cajun shrimp. YUMMMMM! My boyfriend and I waited to go with our friends Mario and Sonya. They were always who we went with in Cali so it just made sense that we check out the new location together. I am in there looking like a tourist. It is set up so you enter through a gift shop, go up stairs and wait for a hostess. It looks just like all the other locations with great Forrest Gump decor. Everyone was super welcoming and friendly. 5 stars for service all around. Again as a tourist I asked to sit on the patio. It was about 9:30pm so the heat was dying down. We ordered a sampler appetizer that came with seafood hush puppies, chicken, fried shrimp, and shrimp cocktail and a pound of cajun shrimp. To me, the cajun shrimp were the highlight of the entire night.  Mario and I ordered the bucket of trash which is a little of everything. Crab, fish, shrimp. It was average. Not amazing but not bad. My boyfriend had fish and chips which he didn't like, and Sonya had fried chicken, which again was average. Disappointed in average fried chicken because I know its above average in Cali.  Now I understand when going to a seafood restaurant you should expect to pay $20 a plate. Especially on the strip. But oh boy do they rape you on the drinks. $4 sodas and $9 lemonades!?! And they charge for refills?! $160 seemed a little rough for 4 people. But maybe I am just not use to paying attention to the price cuz I am usually on vacation while dining here. But unless its a special occasion or a friend in town, I don't think I will be returning.
First time here, service was great as soon as we walked in the door. I had the Shrimp and Grits, very very good! Our server Rikki was very nice and attentive. I look forward to coming back.

I'm never disappointed when eating at Bubba. If you've read my past reviews, we discovered Bubba while vacationing at Disneyland. The whole family loved it. So when we got a surprise visit from my husband's cousin, we decided to take her here. I also had a gift card given to me for my bday so why not use it. I've seen pictures of friends that have eaten here before and the view when seated outdoors looked amazing. It was! They had heaters  which kept their customers comfortable. The server was attentive, no problem with the customer service. We were also seated right away, no wait. If you've never been, try it and sit outside.

Food was great- Service was deplorable - 6 minutes for a waitress and then only because I flipped to the sign to Stop - it was April 20, we were the because of the LSC menu, she was clueless - ordered an Onion Ring appetizer, was served with no plates, server said he would get some, he goes right back by us with no plates. The waitress stops by on QC check 10 minutes after the main course was served. Complete management failure as the manager was watching all of this. We are not difficult to please, just do your job.
My first time here! The portions were decent, not overly priced but nothing special. A tad salty for my taste but filling.

I love the story behind Bubba Gump, I mean who does not like Forest Gump?! Along with atmosphere the bartender was phenomenal! I hated to see all the people who didn't tip him because he definitely deserved big fat tips! I wish I remembered his name! My meal and that day was only made better by sitting at that bar 3 years ago, yes I still remember.

Food was excellent. ! Service was excellent ! Went with fellow yelper Dodi b. Waitress asked us trivia. It was fun. The Mac n cheese I didn't finish. The macaroni was tiny and the cheese was watery. Tasted like a water cheese packet mix poured into more water with cheap macaroni. But other than that we're definitely going back ! A+ atmosphere and food. And u get free buba gump  Souvenir glasses

This was my first and will very likely be the last time to Bubba Gump Shrimp. This chain restaurant was so well-known that some friends and I stopped here for dinner as soon as we found it without a second thought. But it turned out to be a great disappointment, as the food was not that delicious and was unreasonably expensive. It was so ridiculous that the Shrimper's Heaven only had a few shrimps on the top with the rest of the boxes filled with french fries! If you're a big fan of Forrest Gump, then this would be an interesting restaurant for you. But if you're not, then perhaps it's better to make another wise choice.

After posting my review the manager of this establishment did contact me and apologize for the service I received. He stated he would add credits to my loyalty card. That was 5 months ago. He never added anything or followed up with me. Way to go Landry's Bubba Gump - Vegas. Still love Saltgrass. Bubba Gump is horrible from bottom to top management. Hard to believe an establishment under the Landry's brand operates like this.

Nice to see this restaurant make its way to Vegas. I have never been to one so I ventured in here during lunch over the weekend. As expected, since it is located on the second/third floor of Planet Hollywood's Miracle Mile Shops, the location gets great foot traffic from people on the strip or those coming from the bridge from the Cosmopolitan or Crystals/Aria. The retail store has all sorts of neat shirts, accessories and souvenirs and you have to go up the stairs to access the restaurant section. My eye caught the Stupid is as Stupid Does Shirt!  Since I was on a lunch break I did not take long and went to the bar.   The only TVs I saw were at the bar and I did not see any in the regular dining area so I for now, I do not believe this is a good spot to try to catch any game; only come for the fish and shrimp dining!  I asked the bartender's recommendation and went with a cup of Mama Blues Shrimp Gumbo. He explained the gumbo as having worchestire sauce in it with a little kick and I like that sauce in my marinades so I was sold.  Surely enough, there was a little spice but   The main course I ordered was the accidental fish/shrimp. This was a broiled mahi mahi with jasmine rice, grilled shrimp that came with a side of lemon butter with roma tomatoes. I've had freshly caught mahi mahi in Hawaii so I have a high standard when it comes to this fish. The one they served came very close but not quite that standard. It was a generous portion and came with some shrimp which I thought could have been bigger.   The price of the meal was kind of high as well but that's what's expected from restaurants on the Vegas strip. This was a great experience and hopefully I'll buddy up with one of the staff there to come back in and get a discounted hookup. lol.

I've been a big fan of Bubba Gump's ever since I was introduced to their location in San Francisco and ate there a few times. So when my hubby brought me to Las Vegas for our first wedding Anniversary, and for my first time ever in Las Vegas, we debated a TON on what to have for dinner. As we ventured out on our night which he had decided on walking around and eating to wherever calls us...he said..."Hey, there's a Bubba Gump's here!" I look over to see he's on Yelp!  I said, "You know what, I could go for some Gump's!" And away we went! The line was non existent and the restaurant had some open tables. We were behind a larger group, both of us asking for outdoor seating... Without asking if we wanted to wait, we were immediately sat in the dining room while the larger group was taken outside. When we arrived at our table I asked the host, "Um, was there no seats outside?"  He said "There's a ten minute wait."  Ok whatever... We just took the booth.  Our waitress came quickly and was great the entire night! My hubby ordered the Burger and I ordered the bucket of seafood at Market Price. Food came fast and my bucket of seafood was amazing and so was the extra garlic bread we ordered. We love this place so I know we'll be back.

First time trying this place, was kind of skeptical at first but I had such a good time! From the trivia game to the "free" cup, I can say that I will be going back! We had Charles & Rey as our servers and we couldn't be any happier! They were attentive and they answered all our questions. Will be going back for the food and the staff!

I was first introduced to this restaurant back in 2005 in Cali. Glad they finally made their way to Vegas. Bubba Gump Shrimp Co is located ON THE STRIP. Tourist central. Nothing wrong witth that. But just be warned of the strip traffic especially if you go during peak hours.  Everytime I go to Bubba Gump, I ALWAYS...and I repeat, ALWAYS get the SAME appetizer and the SAME entree.  For the appetizer I get the Cajun Shrimp. Let me tell you, THAT stuff is delicious!!!!!! The spices, the dipping oil, the garlic bread that comes with it....ohhh man. Excuse my TMI but it's like an orgasm in the mouth!!!!!!!  For my entree, I get the Shrimp Scampi pasta. The sauce is light yet flavorful. The bowl is big enough for me to have leftovers for the next day.  Welcome to Vegas, Bubba Gump!
Good location to watch the cowboys/packers game and watch the strip. Had the cup of Gumbo and Pear and Berry Shrimp Salad with moscato wine. Our server Stacy really made the experience worthwhile!

Very fun and delicious place on the Vegas strip that will forever remind me of my wife and I's first day in Las Vegas.  The shrimp is the best I've ever had and they make it many different creative ways. You might think it's just a seafood place, but you're wrong.   A fun family atmosphere for a casual price. They have surprise trivia mixed in and the staff is fun. Awesome vacation stop for a family or couple.

I've been here 3 times and I love it! The staff is great they know good customer service! I love how they ask you quick trivia questions about the Forrest Gump movie it's pretty fun. The food is great I ordered Mommas fried chicken and it is delicious, especially the mashed potatoes they tasted homemade. This is one of my go to places when I visit Vegas!

Great location, great shrimp, horrible service, and horrible management. We waited 15 minutes after being sat then asked to be waited on. The food was served fast after it was ordered. The waitress never came back. After 45 minutes and asking 3 different wait staff, we asked to speak to a manager.  He couldn't find our bill. Finally the waitress came with a $250 check.  Our bill should have been $70. Finally they fixed it with no apologies or even discount. It totally ruined our night!

I had the best experience at Bubba Gumps with some of my friends!!! The food was amazing and the drinks were great!!! It's not cheap but the experience makes up for it!   We had an amazing server (Lexi PLEASE request her!!!) and she made us feel so welcomed!!! I'm living in Vegas and this place was very comforting!!! The view of you are by the window is great and the Forrest Gump trivia is hilarious!!! I loved it here and will definitely go here again!! Especially if Lexi is there!!! :-D

We stopped here for dinner on our last night in Vegas during our last trip. We just wanted to sit down and relax, we had had a LONG day. So when we saw Bubba Gumps we just said what the heck and got in line! We had a wait of maybe 30 minutes or so, not too bad. We were seated at a table and our server immediately took our drink orders. Our waiter was very nice, we liked him a lot.   We both ordered massive amounts of food haha, we were so hungry! We started with the popcorn shrimp appetizer which was surprisingly great. I had some huge platter of fried seafood, I loved it all. And my boyfriend had something similar which he also liked.   This place is a lot of fun, I bet kids would really like it. They also have these awesome special cups that you can take home.. They light up! Of course I had to get one:)  I would absolutely come here again because it was great and we had a fun time!

Ohmigosh!  Fly here just for this!!  I love seafood and I make my own incredible Jambalaya. . .but I have been defeated and rendered helpless for any seafood place I have ever been to.  Just pay the airfare and get here. . .
Good choice for a quick bite. We ordered the seafood platter. The hush puppies were to die for! It's different than others I have eaten. These contain chunks of corn and I believe crab meat.

Went there on a Saturday @ 11:30 a.m or so. So it was good I beat the crowds.  The first thing I noticed was the smell and look of a new building, thats always a plus. They have plenty of space there and the design worked with the location hovering over the strip. The interior stayed true to the theme of the restaurant.  We had a great waitress, I forgot her name but it was evident she enjoyed her job and was truly happy to work there.   The gumbo, EXCELLENT. Even the waitress said "Bet you wish you ordered the large". LOL. I had the cup. Beautiful arrangement and quite a bit of sausage and fish. I destroyed it in about 5 minutes. I recommend anyone reading this to try it.   Had the seafood feast, The fish and shrimp, very tasty. Light and with flavor and not that heavy grease aftertaste as you would have in some places. Seasoned just right. Now some would say that it didn't have enough seasoning to the batter but I think it is just enough to where you don't overwhelm the taste of the actual fish and shrimp.  Try it. I would recommend trying every incarnation of shrimp they serve. I have my sites set on the Shrimpers feast next..  Cloe slaw- cut fresh as you order it, not drenched in mayo. +5  Only thing the jury is out on, and probably because of my own tastes...the hush puppies. I like the more flavorful ones,like at Long John Silvers...if you try both you'll know what I mean. But not work deducting a star, When your main course is good, who cares about the side piece.    My biggest endorsement is that Gumbo, TRY it....You wont be disappointing. Well done Bubba!

It was a Bubba Gump. Everything on the strip looks fancy and this was no exception. Our server Luke was very nice and took good care of us. He even entertained us with a little Forrest Gump trivia contest, which was fun. The food, was not bad, but that might hold true for all Bubba Gumps. This was our first time and we were fairly if not absolutely impressed. Luke's service though was exceptional. He was caring but not overbearing. He checked in on us on a regular basis. He made good suggestions on the menu too that helped us navigate the formidable menu well.

i am such a HUGE fan of forrest gump! it's one of my all time favorite movies! :]  so this was my first time eating at a bubba gump and i've got to say, i fell in love with the theme. it was so interesting! there were so many signs and there were pictures and newspapers. there were also these adorable little signs that said run forrest run, and stop forrest stop!  the prices are were high but i thought it was fun. my friends and i were sat at such a bright room, and it was spacious and white! i think it was meant to resemble forrest's home since it seemed like it was back in the day. it was decorated with plates and pictures which i thought was extremely cool!  the waitresses were the nicest people i've ever met. they came every time, just to check up on us, which means, drinks all day every day!  anyways, loved the place and i'll come back next time when i go back to vegas!

I have experienced better but it was at the Chicago location..maybe because this one is located on the strip they assume people are just drunk and hungover so they will eat anything.. for the most part that is accurate. Especially if they have been smoking cigarettes butt to butt ("butt to butt" sounds funnier than "chain smoking") all night..  I ordered the Cajun shrimp with Garlic toast..super buttery and garlicky and you could tell the shrimp was frozen. My mom got the grilled fish sandwich.. and frowned the WHOLE TIME.. I knew it was over when she asked for tartar sauce..  The server was great.. she kept calling me "baby" though and I don't know how I feel about that.. I'M A GROWN A** WOMAN.. just kidding..but it did get a little annoying..She was prompt and courteous though.

Ok so the drinks were good. Had the lava flow and margarita. The dip was good but greasy. Loved that it had shrimp tho. Ordered a po'boy. I asked if it had some kind of sauce and they said yes. When it came out no sauce . Just mayo on a huge piece of bread I could barely stuff in my mouth. Definitely for a mans mouth. So dry. Had to ask for thousand and just skipped eating the bread. Shrimp alone were good. The service was also good as well as the view.

This wasn't my choice since I lived in New Orleans for ten years and have had it several times.  The group I was with wanted to eat here so I didn't put up a fight.  It was eight of us and the waitress was great at taking the orders and answering questions.  Some had specific requests and that was handled well also.  I split the Shrimper's Heaven and Bubba's After the Storm Bucket of Boat Trash with someone.  The food was cooked well but not very well seasoned.  It was ok.  I also tasted the potato cakes which were average.  The Lt. Dan's Pomegranate Punch was tasty though.  Average seafood.  Nothing outstanding.

If you like Forest Gump, then i would recommend you stopping at Bubba Gump. They have good food and trivia durning your meal. Im sure there is better seafood in vegas but since i have been to other location we decide to stop! Even if you don't like seafood, this is a place to stop because they do a phenomenal job on seasoning.  They also have good Specialty Alcoholic drink with a souvenir cup.
Neat atmosphere. Our server Danny was good spirited and energetic! He definitely helped make the experience fun. My fiancé and I both had the Fried Seafood platter. Good food, and big portions!

Fist time at Bubba Gump's even though there is one near Houston. Bianca was our server and she was very polite and informative since it was our first visit. The food was great, try the jambalaya. A little pricy, but worth it in my opinion. The drinks are tasty as well, plus you get to keep the glass with most of them. Landry's does it again!
I was disappointed.   My shrimp showed signs of freezer burn.  Not up to the standard i expect from Bubba Gump.

I am giving them 1 star because I have to give a star. This was the WORST service I have ever experienced at a restaurant. The service started out good but was progressively slower and slower and one of party didn't get his food for 20 minutes after the rest of us were served (we had to wait 5 minutes after we were served for someone to "stop, forest, stop" at the table so we could inquire. The appetizers were good and my garden salad was fresh and very tasty. I had the coconut shrimp and I enjoyed it very much. 3 of the others in our party had a sampler of shrimp (I don't know the name of the exact dish). The tempura battered shrimp was soggy and tasteless and went uneaten. They reported (I didn't taste it) the seasoned shrimp was over seasoned and cold but the grilled shrimp in the plate was excellent.   Drinks were VERY SLOW to come out from the bar. One of our party ordered a whiskey based drink and felt the whiskey taste was too strong. Several of us ordered top shelf margaritas and they were okay, but didn't taste too shelf. The plastic shaker they were in leaked and our hands were sticky, so the design wasn't good. 2 members got a "free" cup with their drink, but it wasn't explained they had to take their receipt to the lobby to get it, so that took time waiting for the cup that wasn't coming (check your bag they hand you if you get this because one of the gals only got the shaker lid and not the actual cup.   Our main complaint was that management didn't seem to care about the "missing in action" food and wasn't proactive in letting us know it was being taken care of. When we complained, management (?) sent us a beautiful complimentary dessert tray. Unfortunately we had already said we did not want dessert. We really wanted our check and to leave because we had been there for so long. It took forever to get the checks (the checks were split. I honestly don't know if the server was told when we placed orders we wanted to split the checks and I understand it takes longer to do that after the fact, but 30 minutes? We were sitting outside freezing. It took a good 40-45 minutes from the time we said no dessert to the time we got our checks and got out of there. I believe they took an appetizer off of someone's bill and took something else off another persons bill (I don't know what).  The "missing meal" should have been free and a free appetizer and no dessert should have been sent (a nice gesture but we honestly wanted to leave and it just extended the time we were sitting there waiting for the checks, so it wasn't something that made the situation better, unfortunately).  Food was generally decent, drinks were overpriced for what you got but the service killed the experience. The "run forest run/stop forest stop" plaques sitting at the table that indicate to servers and management something is needed did NOT seem to help in getting service. The concept that if ANY team member sees the "stop forest stop" at ANY table, they stop and ask what is needed is a great concept and I have eaten at other locations where the service was excellent using this model. Perhaps it was an off night or they were short staffed, but the service failed miserably as did managements handling of the situation.

"The food is great, but the portions could be a tad more". I recommend the Jumbalaya and the Cajun style bucket of shrimp! Cocktails here are also good. If you are going here on a weekend (I have not been here on a weekday) get there early because the line will fill! Lol.

At all California locations I've have a wonderful staff interaction with trivia and explanation of table service. This location lacked that. It changed the experience for my guest first time visit. All in all everything else was up to par!

The restaurant has good tasting seafood the price is a bit high for the portions you receive great view  a good atmosphere service is friendly food is like I said good but small portions the wait sometimes takes a while depending on what time of the day you go and what day of the week

Our visit didn't start out well.  We waited in Landry's VIP line only to be told to move to the regular line by Patrick.  After move lines i noticed someone else in the VIP line and they were seated immediately.  I asked Patrick what the VIP line was for?  He said it was for members.  Once i showed Patrick my member # he thought nothing of it.  If it wasn't for Frankie, our awesome waiter, i would have given this place 1 star.  The food was delicious but Patrick ruined it for us.  We will not eat here again.

Seafood is my weakness and to find bubba Gump shrimp was like finding treasure for me. I loved the whole concept of the place. Photos of Forrest Gump, artifacts, benches and decor is just mind blowing. This place was connected to a bubba gump giftshop too. If anyone were interested to get little something , they had that option.  We were sitted very quickly as we walked into the Restaurent. our server was nice and knowledgeable . She suggested how much bucket shrimp should we order for two people and if it was too much food for us or not. Which helped us make decision.  We got a bucket of cajun and garlic shrimp. Cajun was our favorite because of its unique flavor. Also got a shrimp scampi pasta. It was very light and tasty. Not too much added thats why it was nice to eat. I really liked the place.

Stopped by here for dinner after a long flight. Have heard about it but never been. I ordered the dish with 4 different shrimps and a margarita. Enjoyed the shrimps and like the concept. They have nice belcony seating overlooking the Strip. Service was fast and they dont hassle you. They come when you want them to. A bit pricey. Food - 5 Service - 5 Atmosphere - 5 Value/Price - 3

The place was empty when we arrived at 11am. The waitress seemed dull and unhappy to be there until the time to pay came around. Maybe she was having a bad morning? She explained to flip the sign over when we needed something. My friend said "why wouldn't she just casually check in every once in a while, instead of needing the sign?" Good point. We did not see the waitress in the quiet restaurant until the sign flipped for a refill. My friends all LOVED the food! I had the fried chicken breast with mashed potatoes and corn on the cob. The breading was crispy and the chicken was juicy, although no flavor or seasoning to it. I dipped mine in the gravy from potatoes to give it something. The potatoes were great and portion size was huge. It came with 2 breasts stacked. I split the meal with a friend, and glad I did when we saw it arrive with 2! Fun atmosphere, but I felt like the Chicago location's wait staff were more fun and friendly.

Forrest Gump is one of my favorite movies so I was so excited to come here!   To sum up in a word: disappointed. The food had no flavor whatsoever. I think I added the entire salt shaker to the bucket of shrimp we got. It's "spiciness" is comparable to celery. Also, my brother got the seafood pasta. Waaay too overpriced. The wait was pretty long too.  One star because our waitress was nice.

We came here for a late night dinner and it was a pretty average experience. Food took longer than we liked/expected at 10:00pm. The waiter seemed visibly annoyed when we didn't purchase beverages and the food was okay. I didn't like the gumbo at all but the New England clam chow Eder was tasty. Coconut shrimp were okay when hot but cooled fast and weren't as good then. I don't prefer chains and this is a situation where I'm like this is why! The NYC location is much better.

No, no, no. I know Bubba Gump's is a tourist trap but we were in a rush, so we settled on Bubba Gump's. Big mistake. Our server was nice enough and explained that the "STOP FORREST STOP" and "RUN FORREST RUN" signs were used to call over the wait staff when service was needed. OK, gimmicky and kind of cute. We never ended up using them, though. I went for the Shrimp Scampi and my husband got the jambalaya. Our food came out within 10-15 minutes, pretty quick. My husband liked his jambalaya but also commented halfway through eating it that it got old pretty fast. As for my scampi, it was very lemony which is not my preference for this dish, but it was fine. What was NOT fine was the fact that the shrimp was most definitely overcooked. Ugh. You'd think a seafood restaurant could saute shrimp and not overdo it. Not only that, but I felt the overall portions were pretty small for what you were paying.  To make things worse (considering I was in a hurry to leave the restaurant), the computers went down after our server took our card. I think we were waiting 20-30 minutes for that to pass before she was able to swipe the card. Bah!

Had a great experience here. Good food and great service. Will eat here again. We had the special meal along with the special cocktail and got to keep the glass. Really feel the atmosphere picks up the spirit of the movie.
Great food great prices. We ate here on vacation our waiter was awesome. It was a fun place to eat with friends. You also got big portions for the price will be going back again.

This is the worst meal I've ever had at a restaurant and it cost a small fortune. We went for my son's birthday because we love shrimp and we love Forrest Gump and have always wanted to try it here. The fried shrimp tasted funny. I ate one and didn't like it at all but figured I'm paying for it. So I tried to eat a second one but gave up, so they were wasted. We ordered dessert because I was so disappointed with the meal I figured at least the cookie sundae would be nice. Nope. The cookie was completely over baked and super dried out. Everywhere else I've had one serves it kind of gooey and delicious but this one was awful. What a let down to have bad shrimp at a shrimp place!  Also, the "garlic bread" didn't taste much like garlic. More like buttered bread. You'd think when the waitress took away my plate & saw all the shrimp still on it, she would have asked if something was wrong but she didn't. So I told her the shrimp wasn't good and she just said sorry and walked off. Didn't offer to do anything to satisfy us or correct the situation. I will NEVER go back. $65 down the drain.  (Also having some serious intestinal issues today. Gee, I wonder if that has anything to do with bad shrimp???)

Danny was hands down the best server! His attention to detail was great and he was overall just very pleasant. I will definitely come back here after this experience! The jambalaya was also bomb, 5 stars no doubt!!

Me ganó el turista y me tenía que dar una pasada para la foto. Es un restaurant de comida de mar como cualquier otro, con el agregado de la marca. La atención es buena, y es un lugar muy amplio. Cuando lo visitamos estaba casi vacío, y nos pudimos sentar en una de las mesas del balcón con vista al Strip, que le suma muchos puntos!   La comida esta buena, son porciones abundantes. Probamos unos Shrimper's Heaven con salsas para "picar" y de principal probe un Texas Cajun Chicken Sandwich que era una locura (bacon, guacamole, pepperjack cheese, y muerte (?)).  Tienen muchos tragos propios, y aunque algunos parecen más jugos con un toque de alcohol, otros son apropiadamente refrescantes y valen la pena (Alabama Southern Punch), además de que todos vienen en vasos diferentes. Detalle medio vendehumo, pero en la carta algunos tienen una marca al lado del nombre, y eso significa que te regalan el vaso en cuestión, lo cual es un plus pavote pero que suma.  El servicio muy bueno y rápido. El sistema de poner el cartelito para que el mozo venga cuando pueda es copado. En la planta baja del local tenes toda la sección de souvenir donde retiras el vaso de tu trago y podes comprar otras pavadas de Forrest Gump.

I recently went to the Bubba Gumps restaurant on the Las Vegas Strip near Planet Hollywood and the Shops.  It was great!  We loved our waitress who was very attentive!  It is pretty cool that they have license plates on the table (red and green) side.  This will either bring the nearest Waitress/Waiter to your table or not.  Our regular Waitress still stopped by but that was more for immediate service.  Our waitress also quizzed us about the movie Forest Gump which was pretty cool!  I would definitely go back!  I had the Shrimp Mac and Cheese and it definitely didn't disappoint!

Not sure why this place is 3.5 stars, perhaps a lot of people get peel and eat shrimp (which I hate, regardless of the quality). I would go with the momma Gumps southern fried shrimp it is the second best I have ever had behind Florida seafood in cocoa beach Florida. Price wise this place is comparable to red lobster, but the quality far surpasses red lobster. Defiantly worth having, my wife and I loved it.
Great food and service!  Little pricey, but unique, tasty dishes.  We have always wanted to try them out and were pleasantly surprised.

Giving this 4 stars because my family really enjoyed the food.  We followed the server's recommendations and none of us were disappointed.  My daughter had the fish and my wife shrimp while I had the Jambalaya.  No complaints from anyone.  Service was excellent - we were actually served by a guy named 'Bubba'  :-).  A little of the pricey side though.

I've been to a number of Bubba Gump restaurants because my husband is a huge fan of the place for some reason.  I find the food to be pretty consistent no matter which restaurant we go to.  This is the first time we visited the one in Vegas.  I'm the one who spotted it and pointed it out to my husband.  He said he wouldn't have noticed it had I not pointed it out.  I mentally kicked myself for being observant after eating here.  The food was pretty standard Bubba fare - the best ever popcorn shrimp was still pretty good, the fish and chips still average.  My issue with this location is the service.  Our waitress came to our table all of twice - once to take our order, once to bring the bill.  At every other Bubba's I've been to the servers have been really friendly and they always come and quiz you on Forrest Gump trivia while you're waiting for your food.  I don't know if this is just something they don't do at this particular Bubba Gump location or if we just had a really lousy server but I don't imagine I'll be dining at Bubba Gump in Vegas again when there are so many other good places to eat.

This place gets a one star and the number 1 reason is because the hostes/manager Sarah. She was extremely rude and disrespectful. She did no care about our service and basically denied our service into this restaurant. I am a visitor here and I never dealt with such foolishness and disrespect. Beware of her. As the face of this restaurant she is awful and mean.

Came here cuz of course we love bubba Gump but being to a lot of bubba gumps I have never experienced such great customer service from a gentleman named Chris. I really hope your boss sees this & you get awarded somehow. This experience just made our weekend a whole lot more enjoyable. People should learn from this guy what it is to have customer service. Thanks for taking a picture of us to Chris!!!!

This place has a whole lot of really cool movie memorabilia decked out all over the walls inside from the film and to be fair it was pretty cool to see that stuff.  We decided to share a few appies and got some peel and eat shrimp and some other spicy shrimp dish. The food was just OK considering the fairly inflated prices. It wasn't any better than anything one might find at Red Lobster, and given that RL is the Walmart of seafood establishments it wasn't that great. I enjoy good seafood, the like of which one might find at The Fisherman's Restaurant on the Pier in Seattle, or Captain John's Seafood Buffet in Kitty Hawk NC on the Outer Banks. I had a margarita with a baby Corona dumped into it which was decent.  I think if you are into film nostalgia, for THAT one film, and like shrimp go for it. Just don't expect to come away raving about your out of body seafood experience.
We had such a great time. Kristin was a fantastic server and the food was on point. I might have to come here every time I'm in Vegas. Better than the hotel restaurants!

Went with a group of people last night before closing. I am four months pregnant and asked for a well done burger as I have to eat throughly cooked meat. My burger was burnt to the point that it was inedible. Didn't want to make a fuss so I didn't eat it. Waiter charged me for extras I didn't purchase. Hesitated to fix. Ended up double charging my credit card. Let him know and he became upset and started to sigh. Didn't tip him for his rude service. Checked my balance again, a third charge has come up. Very dismal, horrible service. First time and last time I will eat here.

Loved this place.  Had dinner here before a show we were seeing at the Aria (which is right across the street).  They do NOT take reservations, do call ahead seating, etc., so I was slightly concerned about getting a table, but since we were willing to sit inside (the outside deck is very popular), we got a table after waiting in line about 10 minutes, so not bad at all for a Vegas night.  Drinks were awesome, service was very good and quick and the food was very tasty.  Was really glad to see a Bubba's in Vegas, and I highly recommend.

Service was exceptional. Takes them awhile to get the food ready but it tastes decent. Kinda pricey for the portions we got. Rowdy environment. Nice view inside and out. I'd recommend the lobster salad. Burger was not worth it. Bubba gump bubba bubba bubba gump!

Let me preface this by saying  I DON'T LIKE SEAFOOD. I wish i was so enamored with it that I could destroy a bucket of shrimp and be happy about it, but I cain't.   I just cain't.  Okay -- now that that's done, I can confidently tell you that the solid 3 stars is only based on the service. The food left a bit to be desired. WIth all of the seafood buffet opportunities, I think that this BG cannot afford mediocrity.   We were greeted on the first floor by the hostess, who ushered us into the store and up the stairs. There was a short wait, then we were seated. I can imagine this place when it's busy, and I definitely do NOT want to be waiting on the stairs, my man.   Our waitress was entertaining and gregarious. She was also very attentive to our table and got us whatever we needed, which was nice.    My friend had the fish and chips. The chips were good. Not many places can ruin fries - no worries there. But the "fish?" Boo. WAAAAAAAAAAAY too much breading, she could barely find the meat!  Fun fact: you tell the waitstaff that you need help by flipping over the license plate signs to the RED side. This lets your waiter know that you are ready for service or you have a concern/question. They'll tell you that, " you're in the drivers' seat."   I see what they did there.    I got the burger. It was really good, but nothing spectacular. It kept well, but I was not too happy about the price tag. I believe there was only one option for a burger, so I was sour that I felt overcharged to add cheese to the burger.   And what is a burger without cheese? WHAT. IS IT?  The outside seating looked pretty appealing, but it was definitely chilly considering the temperature had dipped down into the 50s. and for the desert during midday, that was a little too CRISPin Glover for me.    If you know you're about to get the chili's rate seafood experience, then you will not be dissapointed. As my friend pointed out, she would have liked more fish with her breading. From what I saw her pick off, it was an accurate assessment of the FISHuation.    ...that kind of worked.

Bubba's is a decent place to go with decent, Vegas priced fish and burgers.  If you haven't been to one of these chains before, it's worth the visit. They're known not so much for their food but for their Forest Gump themed decor. Every inch of the walls, down to a separate room in the joint wallpapered to look like one in his famous house. They've got a license plate system on the tables, a blue Run Forest run plate for when you and yours are doing fine and a red Stop Forest Stop plate for when you need a napkin or a drink. Any waiter nearby will be there to help.  They've got a big menu that encompasses many different items that are sure to satisfy any picky eaters needs. There are a few Forest-themed drinks, but, being in Vegas it's really not much.  I've been to a few different Gumps in my days and the food is always pretty good. This place was no different. I devoured most of the hearty helping of fish and chips in front of me. Our waiter was friendly, joking with us and quizzing us on our Forest Gump knowledge.  This location is nice too, right off the walkway across from The Cosmopolitan. There's also a terrace to sit outside if it's not as chilly as it was when we were there.   This is a nice family place to eat on the Strip with the slightly over priced grub you'll find all over Vegas. Yum.
Expensive for a chain restaurant. The manager who took our reservation and our server both had great customer services skills. Food was okay, not great for the price we paid.
Tried the shrimp New Orleans and the stuffed shrimp both were delish!!! Wanted to try some of the drinks but it's 113 degrees and I want to see/do more

Never coming back to this place ever. Might be the worst seafood I had ever had. Ordered a shrimp heaven and a shrimp came out looking like someone ate the shrimp and threw the tail back in the batter. Completely lost my appetite. But the manager completely swear that that is not the case and the chef is always on the line and watches everyone cooks move. So it is impossible for that to happen. So she walks away and does nothing to help or correct the situation. SORRY BUBBA GUMP LIFE IS LIKE A BOX OF CHOCOLATES AND YOU FOUND YOURSELF A LEMON OF A MANAGER.

Unfortunately, I wasn't impressed. Look at it, does it look appetizing. NO!   The food lacked flavor and service was meh. I tried one of their shrimp pots. Which were undercooked. Potatoes were undercooked and overall, it was just nasty. The seasoning wasn't even right. They used way too much paprika. Do yourself a favor and find "real" seafood elsewhere...off the strip preferably.

Omg the service here is incredible. Every time our sign (that indicated we needed service) was turned, someone appeared. Not just our waitress...whoever was there! We have eaten at some of the finest places in Vegas, and yet I was blown away by the people and atmosphere here.   Oh, and the jambalaya  was phenomenal!   Thank you, Recee, for serving us one of the best meals we had in Vegas!

I love this place.  It's fun and quirky and if you're a Forrest Gump movie fan like I am, this is a must stop!  The waitresses will come and play trivia with you and test your movie IQ.  I love all the  movie memorabilia and I always check the clearance section in the store downstairs, you never know what cha gonna get! lol   the only thing is the food is just ok, I don't think I've ever eaten here and wanted more.  but I love the experience! and they do honor the troops by doing events and offering a discount in the store & restaurant.  Gotta love that!
Overall the food was really good, I was impressed with the food, even though it was pricey. But your in Vegas you have got to eat good food and that costs $$$. Waitress was friendly.

Outstanding, friendly and fast service. My wife and I had the Cajun shrimp appetizer. For dinner we had the shrimp pasta with capers. It was outstanding. We ate every bite. We also had a few beers.  Our server even offered us to go cups for our beer. Gotta love Vegas.

We came here for dinner since we wanted some seafood for dinner.  Parking was hard to find but that's everywhere along the strip.  The restaurant was easy to find thanks to Yelp.  Upon arriving at the restaurant the line was fairly long.  We just sat at the bar so we didn't have to wait to be seated.    Upon sitting the bartender was very knowledgeable of the menu and drinks came fairly quickly.  We ordered the Run Across America Sampler for our appetizer which included the Bubba's Far Out Dip and Chips, Chilled Peel 'n' Eat Shrimp, Spicy Chicken Strips, Seafood Hush Pups and Mama Blue's Fried Shrimp.  The Spicy Chicken Strips were great.  My girl liked the shrimp on the appetizer.  Overall, being from New Orleans I have had better fried shrimp.  For our entree, we ordered the Soup & Salad Combo which was a house salad with Gumbo and the Shrimp Po' Boy which consisted of a Fresh Toasted Baguette stuffed with warm, hand breaded  Shrimp, Tomatoes, Lettuce, Pickles & Mayo, Served with Fries.  The food came out quick and that was a huge plus saying that it was packed.   The food was ok.  The shrimp Po-Boy could have had more seasoning to make the food more enjoyable.  I have had better.  My lady didn't like her salad and she said the gumbo wasn't good.  Overall, this restaurant was ok.  Would have gave them a 1 if it wasn't for the service.  Probably wont be attending this restaurant again.

Ummm half empty restaurant and we walk in with a party of five asking to eat appetizers and drink. They said sorry the patio is only for people who eat food. As the saying goes, "stupid is as stupid does". Happy 50th birthday to me. Just not at this place.  We ended up at another patio and dropped about $250. They welcomed us with open arms.

I hate to give a bad review but there is simply nothing much to brag about I've tried this location 3 times and only came back for the second and third time hoping that it would get better but it just doesnt do anything for you right, the food isn't very well seasoned the only  only thing that's worth even bragging about is the strawberry shortcake everything else is just plain humdrum nothing special doesn't leap out at you it has a name & catchy touristy gimmicks but other than that it's not worth the price

My boyfriend has had Bubba Gump in California before & wanted me to try it. I was not disappointed! We were greeted and seated right away. We ate on the balcony/patio overlooking the strip, which made for a lovely view. They had heat lamps on to keep the guests warm outside. Our server, Jon, was friendly, attentive, and quick (without making you feel rushed). I ordered a pineapple margarita and my partner ordered the frozen mango margarita. They were delicious. For entrees, I had the shrimp po boy, which had a ton of shrimp & a generous portion of fries. My boyfriend ordered the shrimp scampi, which was served with a piece of garlic bread & smelled heavenly. I wish we had room for dessert! At the end of the meal, our server told us that we get a free gift because we ordered a frozen margarita. We went downstairs to the merchandise area of the restaurant and were given a Bubba Gump shaker. Awesome! If you love seafood & great service, come to Bubba Gump's!
Oh my goodness, shrimp boaten captain extraordinary.  I can't wait to go back.  The Shrimp Heavener is heavenly.

The shrimp here was average. I went with a healthier option on the menu and did not get my shrimp fried, I got the kabobs. There was nothing special about the dish BUT the shrimp were cooked properly. I would go back here and try something different. Also great decor from Forest Gump!!!

Sam: our waiter is amazing! Super sweet and friendly young man. Very informative on not only the restaurant but Vegas itself. The food on the other hand was the worse Bubba Gump I've been to. My husband's dish has so much Cajun seasoning we had to use a napkin to wipe off the excess in order to eat it. My shrimp po boy was nothing to write home about nor the spinach artichoke dip. Kudos to the bar tender and Sam only

While Forrest Gump may be one of my favorite movies, this spot is not one of my favorite places to eat. I got my order to go, the seafood platter and everything tasted overly salty, like the batter was made that way. The dipping sauces that came with it were too spicy for my taste, so the too spicy too salty combo guaranteed the hotel sold some extra bottles of over priced water that night. Maybe I just caught a bad night, so I'm giving it a three star chance since it seemed to have some promise. ...meh

I love shrimp,  so when my husband suggested Bubba Gump, I was surprised.  We decided to make a u-turn on the Vegas strip and get SOME SHRIMP....   As you walk in your in a novelty store with lots of Forrest Gump paraphernalia.  It's like being on a movie set. This is fun.....   You walk upstairs and their are more items all on the wall, hanging from the celling.... this is so cool.  As we are seated on the table, their are questions and answers about the movie.  I wanna play...  Our waiter was a bubble guy named Charles. He appeared with a warm smile and  trivia questions. I don't think I'm ready. LoL...  First questions, nope I didn't know the answer let's just say I needed to see Forrest Gump again...  Now it's time for lunch... I ordered the filet in a garlic butter sauce. Wow....delicious! I was truly surprised that I enjoyed it that much.    Dessert was banana bread.... HELL NO.... dont do it! It was watery and mushy.  Listen not everything is worth the money this is one banana bread I wouldn't order again, ever.   The waiter was so nice he removed the banana bread from our bill, so I decided to make his tip worth it.    All in all its a fun place to walk down Forrest Gump memory lane. I would give this place another shot.....

My wife and I decided to eat here and it was the worst decision ever, I order a jumbo shrimpers net catch. I first noticed it had no sauce, and when I took the first bite, the shrimp felt dried and it tasted a bit odd, "not like Cajun" I ignored it but almost halfway I had to stopped because I was just in shocked of how flavorless it tasted. When I got up from that seat I felt a bit weird, so as I was heading towards the parking lot, it hit me, "did I just get food poisoned" next thing I know I'm on my knees puking everything. Worst place I have visited and I have never gotten food poisoning. They don't deserve a single star.

Fast perfekt :)   Mit hungrigem Mägen Warteten wir ungeduldig in der Warteschlange ,die recht zügig voran kam ...  Endlich an unseren Platz (leider mitten im Gang) war David direkt da...der Herrgott unter den Scampis  (nein er war einfach schnell und wir hatten Hunger )  Top Service !!!  Es gab Pasta mit Meeresfrüchten. für knapp 20 kein Schnäpperchen,aber yummi (!)  So ,wann kommt es nach Deutschland ? Am Besten Hamburg Hafen !

My server....Tammy...she was awesome sauce!!!  Her demeanor was pleasant.  She had good recommendations.  The girl who sat us down was nice too.  She made suggestions and I tried it...(I can't remember the dish) but it was good & I was pleased.  I wanted shrimp and that's what I got.  It wasn't busy.  We were seated immediately.  I am pleased w/ my visit.  The manager was funny and kind and when I visit Vegas I'll be back!  I bought stuff from the gift shop downstairs...the tall chocolate guy downstairs....very pleasant as well....I'd buy sweatshirts from him any time...   Bad part - the nasty little greeter outside who was picking her nose and face when we came up and offered us a place to eat??  It made me nervous to go inside...and she needs to put that ponytail up in a net too!!
Each draft beer is $15? Ridiculous! Food was decent... im seriously disappointed... I have eaten in other places in the strip and this is insane
Coconut Shrimp and Shrimp Mac and Cheese were really good, would defiantly recommend those. The restaurant also has a great view looking over the strip.
Really good service and, well, it's Vegas so everyone's in a pretty good mood.  Wasn't crazy about the food but it's what they advertised.  Fair is fair.

The theme of Bubba Gump is from the Forrest Gump movie - our server told us to flip the sign to get other waiters/waitresses' attention, cute concept. Speaking of our server, BIG shout out to you, Shan! He gave us great recommendations for places to go, things to do in LV - so helpful, thank you! :)  MANGO SHAKER [No-alchy] So yummy! Since it was like a sauna outside, this drink was thrist-quenching. Tasted like a mango soda.  FORREST'S SEAFOOD FEAST (Hand Breaded Southern Fried Shrimp, Seafood Hush Pups, Fish & Chips) Loved the shrimp.. was very delicious - especially if you add the tartar sauce with it! (sauce boss here..)  SHRIMP + FISH + SKEWER [I can't remember the name they had on the menu -_-] The title says it all. The shrimps were once again marinated deliciously! Comparing the two mains that we've ordered, I'd prefer the fried foods :P

This was my first time eating here, so wasn't sure what to expect. Service was a little slow for it not to be crowded. I orederd appetizers as my main meal, and it came out cold. New order still wasn't as hot as I like, and food was just OK. Not sure if I'll go back.

This was not a great experience. The service was solid, but nothing special. The food was lacking. The jambalaya was worse than cheesecake factory. The salads did not have fresh ingredients. Also. Lt. Dan's sausage dish was small. Nothing was really filling.

Stopped at this Bubba Gump location for lunch my first day in Vegas. For a table 6, we were seated quickly. We had a awesome waitress, told us little about Vegas. We had visited a Bubba Gump before so we knew what to order. Shared seafood platter, bowl of gumbo and buckets of shrimp. Drink specials was good. Nice clean restroom. Nice view of the strip, we were seated right across from Crystal Shops.

The food was just what you expect from a Bubba Gumps, but what was really great about this location was the service. I had one of the best waiters I have ever had! Hopefully all the staff is like him. Quick service as well.

I was so excited to finally try Bubba Gumps finally. We ordered two appetizers. They were terrible. The spinach dip should say that it is mostly onions. It was awful. And the hush puppies weren't hot enough and they were just okay. We had the bucket of shrimp and fish. It was okay, but nothing to write home about and it won't bring us back. Our water was great and doing his best.

Everyone was sooo friendly. From the gentleman at the front door who answered all our questions, to the employees we met on our way up.  We were sat right away and our server was awesome and provided us with great service, I just wish I remembered his name.  The food was excellent as well. Between four of us we had a little bit of everything, shrimp scampi pasta, mahi mahi, BBQ ribs with fries and a burger.  All was delicious.  If I am ever in town again, I will definitely be back.
Food is just so, so. Service was good. Chain restaurant food that is just nothing special. It tastes and looks the same wherever you find this restaurant.

Stop Forrest, stop. I have somehow amassed a ridiculous amount of Bubba Gump glassware over the years. My one goal going in here was to leave without another one.   If they can train a bit more and improve on their accuracy, I know this place could move up to a 4 or 5 star.  My daughter insisted that we dine here, so she could get their hush pups. We were seated instantly. Most importantly and first thing, my daughter excitedly requested hush pups.  I selected a glass of Pinot Grigio for $8 and my daughter wanted to try the Blue Hawaiian at $15. Average drink prices for the strip.   After our drinks arrived, we made our dinner selections. We were told our hush pups would be out shortly.   Our food was served after awhile, still no hush pups.  Our server apologized and said our pups went to the wrong table and they would make some more. At that point, I wanted to cancel them but my daughters puppy dog eyes wouldn't let me.   My clam chowder was pretty good, served with a very basic green salad. My daughter said her shrimp po boy was average.   A server tried to deliver some sort of shrimp tower to our table that we didn't order.   Stop Forrest, stop.  Then, after another 10 minutes or so, our hush pups landed. My daughter was full from her drink + dinner, she ate...  one. It was gummy inside. Sigh.  No offer to take it off the bill for us.   We were handed a receipt and told to turn it in downstairs for a souvenir glass. Oi
First time at a Bubba Gumps. Won't be the last. The cajun flavor added was delish. Staff was super friendly. When you flip your sign for something, they are there so fast-its like magic.
The staff was very attentive and engaging after the little incident.  Food was awesome! Drinks crazy good.

the food is good, & the service is EXCELLENT! our server stephen went above and beyond his job!! HE kept us entertain while waiting for our food to arrive...(which didn't take that long)   it's my mom's birthday.. aside from the desert we ordered, they gave us something on the house too as well!!   the manager checked in on us if we are having  a good time. I'm telling you guys, if you want a good food, and service matters to you. check this place out! it's awesome!

Had to send the food back because it was cold, however the manager was extremely helpful.  The Forrest Gump trivia was funny, so brush up on your Forrest Gump trivia.  I didn't realize I know so much about the movie.

2.5 stars. Similar to the Orlando location but more spacious which gives it more of a cafeteria look and feel. While their food can be fun to eat, they fall short on healthy choices at all locations, so not unique to this one. Doubt we will be going back because of that. But if you like fried stuff and are looking for a low key place, it's not bad.
The food is not seasoned. Not even close to edible. One star is too many I would give none. I am from the south with no high blood pressure and not over weight. I do not recommend this place.

I've been to two bubba Gump locations one in New York and one in city walk both have been great. So my boyfriend and I were in the mood for shrimp after going to a day club when we spotted  bubba gump. The food was delicious and it really satisfied our cravings. The Cajun shrimp and shrimp Mac and cheese was delicious. The plate with corn, sausage and shrimp was really good as well.

I've been to a lot of Bubba Gumps but I would have to say, this location was my favorite!!!   We first wanted to sit outside on patio  and let me tell you... the view of the strip at night was so breath taking. Before we could order, it got a little windy and asked if we can go inside.   Our server was GREAT. She sat us inside and it was way bigger than the other bubba Gumps I've been too. This location is great for big parties.   Our food tasted fresh and very yummy! I can't wait to go back!   O-yeah and since I came in to celebrate my birthday, the whole staff surprised me with free ice cream and sang happy birthday.  I love this place!!!

I don't even remember the meal. It's Vegas FFS. The waiter was awesome though, and I wish I was a billionaire, so I could afford to tip that dude. They gave us 2 free glasses after the meal, which instantly won me over. Cool place. Go here if you're looking for some fishy fishy . BTW I did tip the waiter... 15%, which is a decent sum IMO

Came here for dinner and ordered the heavenly shrimp and it was just okay nothing to really write home about! The service was okay, our waiter had a really thick accent so it was hard to understand what she was saying at times. The food was okay it was just your normal fried shrimp and fries. I wasn't all that impressed!

First time at Bubba Gumps and it was quite an experience. I really enjoyed it, surprisingly. They have a ton of chachski on the walls.. You never know quite where to look but the staff is exceptional. We had a small wait and to keep the patrons from getting antsy they quiz you on Forrest Gump trivia. I'm a quiz/puzzle person so personally I had a bunch of fun.  I felt their pricing was a bit over charged but its on the heart of the strip so its too be expected but otherwise.. all was good.. If they had a more convenient location I could see myself as a local going more. The food wasn't bad not was it exceptional so it isn't a restaurant I would go out of my way for but if im in the area again, i'd go back...
Having lunch at Bubba Gump in Vegas! Awesome people specially Jason our server. He is friendly and hospitable.

Decided to try them and was a big let down. Ordered the Shrimper's Net Catch made with the secret cajun spice recipe for the app and the Dumb Luck Coconut Shrimp as the main. The main came out long before the app and it was a bland soggy mess. The coconut shrimp was ok and definitely not live up to the Bubba Gump reputation! My wife had the Old Fashion New England Clam Chowder and salad. She didn't even finish the clam chowder because it was so bland and not tasty at all. Got a 10% discount because of the snafu of getting the main before the app, but we will definitely not be coming back to this location. May give another location an opportunity for redemption in the future.

This was my first time ever to this restaurant. The food was okay. I had the Shrimp Po Boy sandwich. I wasn't to keen on the fact the sandwich came with mayo (which I had withheld) and I couldn't replace that with a different sauce. The bread was kind of thick, which I didn't care too much for. I asked the server if I could just get popcorn shrimp with fries and he dryly replied "no". The drinks are good, but for $14 you would make out like a bandit at the Rock Bar or Evening Call size wise. The server never said his name, which was the first step to informing me the service wouldn't be superior or close to it. I saw him sitting in a booth with two of his other female customers as cozy as ever. Yeah, no bueno. If I try this place again, they'll have to drag me there.

I was so excited to see a Bubba Gump Shrimp Co restaurant open its doors here in Las Vegas. I've been to the one in Long Beach, Monterey and San Francisco so finally I got to check this one off the list.  Lots of walking to get here-it's located inside the Planet Hollywood Hotel & Casino near the shops with an outdoor patio as an option for dining. Not convenient for locals who have to park and walkkkkkkkkkk.  We were seated right away and our waitress was very cheery and service was great.  I love using the signs at the table so you can easily flag a server down when you flip the sign over to STOP.  We had three servers stop at once-so service was perfect.  A nice kids menu offered favorites like pizza, hamburgers, macaroni and cheese and of course shrimp.  We started off with a refreshing margarita which my only complaint was the small glass that it was served in.  It took a while to get the drink at a perfect cold temperature.  I ordered a variety of shrimp...boiled, coconut and panko fried.  It came with a few different sauces (cocktail, sweet and sour, teriyaki).  Shrimp was cooked perfect and it was a yummy comfort food indulgence.  The shrimp macaroni and cheese was also on item we ordered and it had a nice smoky flavor.  Really good!  The hubby ordered the tilapia and it was served with creamy mashed potatoes and spinach.  Overall I don't think I'll be running back just because of the convenience factor.  Off the strip the elevators and escalators were both not working so if you're on crutches or a cast, or just getting over a foot injury like I am it doesn't really make it easy to get to.

Great location! Just walk up the link bridge btw Cosmo and planet Hollywood there it is. Friendly waitress and once a while will play trivia about forest gump while we waiting for our food to come. Highly recommend shrimp heaven baskets! 4 ways shrimp with crispy flavorful fries, suitable for seafood lover like me.

Ate here last night, we were seated immediately and decided to sit outside to people watch those along the Las Vegas strip. The waiter was pleasant and everything went smooth. I enjoyed my choice of fish, shrimp and jasmine rice which was all in a tasty sauce. My husband had mashed potatoes, fried chicken and corn on the cob. He said he has had better but nonetheless, I was pleased.

The girls had to eat here just to say they did, it was on the bucket list of places to eat , I really love the location and the atmosphere , the adults ate at the steak house the girls wanted bubba gumps , but overall the experience was great
Great service!  We got to sit out on the patio overlooking Las Vegas Boulevard.   Reasonable prices and no wait.  The calamari was REALLY delicious.  We will definitely be back.

Family with teens ate here.  Food was great.  Server, Cat, was super.  Each of us picked a different dessert and tried each of them.  They were amazing.   Wish we had a Bubba Gump near where we live.  We try to eat at Bubba Gump when on vacation where one is near.

The food was good the service not really, why use a system with plates when the employes don't care at all, I switch to red plate and after over 10 minutes some show off to take care, draft beer in plastic glass no bueno
Atmosphere is nice. View of strip is amazing if you sit on the balcony. Food is good for the  $$, but the service was horrible. Probably won't be going back to this one.

First time here and I already love it! I had an appetizer called the shrimp net catch and got half Cajun seasoning and half of their own special seasoning. It was fun and delicious to peel the shrimp. However, the Cajun flavor lacked the spiciness of other Cajun seasonings I have previously tried. I also got a linguine pasta with capers which added a lot of flavor, topped with shrimp. Though it was a bit oily, I would definitely recommend it. Seafood wasn't my favorite, but this place made me love it! Would definitely come back!

Usually love Bubba Gumps but NOT this location. We were there on 3/5. We sat for 15 minutes in a restaurant that was not even half full (1:30pm). Not a single person came by to even offer water or take drink orders let alone take our meal order. Others were seated and waited upon. They literally walked around us to the other tables. It was as though we were invisible. After 15 min we asked for the mgr, told him what happened and left. Spoiled it for us to ever go to another Bubba Gumps.   Even 1 star is too generous but have to rate it something to get it published.

Fun atmosphere but it's all novelty. Waitstaff was great, got in quickly. Was funny when our plates came out and there was only 1 shrimp on the plate, not sure how that made it out to us like that but I have to admit it was funny. Waiter quickly fixed it and brought out the rest of the shrimp, haha still makes me laugh thinking about it. Was a little strange but hey like I said it's novelty.

Been to this place twice in one day, only because Krystian was a great waiter, and my water had the lemon I asked for.. other than that it was an okay experience.  The peel and eat shrimp had the smaller shrimp size, that sucked.... the garlic sauce sucked, it had this sweet sort of sugary taste to it, and the Cajun sauce was weird too, I can't really explain it, however it was not the old bay type of taste I expected. The shrimp PoBoy was more bread and sauce than shrimp and bread. Basic.... honestly the good thing that I liked about this spot other than my water with lemon had to be the fries that came with the PoBoy and the garlic bread that my waiter asked me if I wanted and me saying "yes", not knowing I was going to actually have to pay for it. But welcome to Vegas people! Lol, oh and 3 stars are for the price, if my shrimp was bigger with better sauce it would've been 4 stars....

Food was ok, not as great as the one in Anaheim. Service was ok, nothing great. Went unnoticed for about 10mins until someone approached us to take out order. Food was dry and salty but eatable again nothing spectacular. Probably won't come here again.

My order: gumbo (so good-flavorful)  PROs: +FOOD: very delicious food. Inexpensive drinks. Sometimes you get to keep the cup:) + DECOR: Loved the bubba gump merchandise and decorations. They were adorable. I'm usually not one for franchised restaurants but this one in particular was done very well.  + SERVICE: Amazing. I loved that they have movie themed signs which direct the waiter's attention your way. How nifty!   CONs: - there are no bubba gumps in the east side!!! Come to Toronto, NYC or even Niagara Falls :(   Gotta love bubba gump. I will be back here the first chance I get ;)
Love the food and the sexy service, i will total be eatting here again when i come back to Vegas
Si vas de noche pide una mesa exterior para que disfrutes de la vista al Strip mientras comes tu comida. Bubba Gump Shrimp como siempre delicioso!."
For me good as any other location. Staff friendly. Only issue is that it's difficult to find.

Ok Ok, at first I was bummed about going to a "chain" restaurant in Vegas but I was wrong, it was pretty darn awesome!  I'm a tourist, I bought the Las Vegas Bubba Gump glass my drink came in, it came with a plastic cocktail shaker too!  Ok, onto the food  Fries were Awesome, with the sauces. The Calamari lil soggy. Shrimp Gumbo, Yum! Seafood Paella, Wow! Delicious! PACKED with seafood and packed quite a punch! Spicy! But not too spicy so you can't taste, but pretty close, Mmm! Loved it!  And that drink everyone talked about - Great! Bit sweet but that's to be expected, it's a fruity frozen cocktail. I don't know if I'd run back here given all the other choices in Vegas on and off strip, but i would definitely not be disappointed if this was the chosen dinner venue again.

First visit our server Jessie is awesome. He made excellent recommendations. The drinks are good. The menu presented some interesting food choices. So I ordered the shrimp mac and cheese(tasty), seafood hush pups(tasty), Shrimp New Orleans( over cooked shrimp and the rice tasted like it was old, it was hard and crunchy) I sent it back and my check was adjusted appropriately. The service was so good I gave 4 stars. I would return on my next visit to Vegas & try something new from the menu.
Average food. Average presentation.  Good service. No wow factor. And overpriced. I would consider this a strip tourist destination. No return trip for me.

While visiting LV from California, we were in the mood for some good shrimp and fries. Much to our delight, this Bubba Gump's location was just as good as the San Francisco one, which is excellent. Good service, good food and decent prices (especially for the Strip). It's a MUST.

Our waitress was AMAZING. Her name was  KEISHA. She got us drinks quickly and the food was amazing. No wait at all and she even quizzed us about Forest Gump the movie. Awesome service from all the staff. Great atmosphere and decent prices for the amount of food you get. Definitly recommend.

I would give this place zero stars if possible. Very first night in Vegas we stopped in this place. Hostess was incredibly rude, just dumped us off at a table without saying anything at all. Apparently she never told anyone she seated us. No one came to get our order for 15 minutes. Then a waiter who was not ours finally came up and said he saw us just sitting there so he came to take our order. We told him how long we had been waiting and he said he would get the manager. Waited 10 more minutes and still no one showed up. No manager. No drinks. Nothing. They were not even busy. We left without anyone ever acknowledging we were there. Worst restaurant experience of my life. Would not recommend to anyone.

Every times I visit a new city I make it my business to eat at a Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. Every experience is usually pleasant and having me desiring my next experience. Well my visit to Bubba Gump in Las Vegas in April was the worst that I've experienced. Normally, their warm hospitable experience is consistent nationwide. Well this experience started with being set and not being greeted by our server for 15 mins. Upon experiencing it to our serve Matthew, he said "owww, I didn't know." We decided to talk to a manager and all the manager Bud said was, "let's see if we can speed it up." It took an additional 30 min for my food to arrive to the table, after being told by a support staff that my food had been dropped on the floor. When my food finally arrives it's cold and I'm left to deal with it. I boxed my food up to take back to my room. I felt that there would be no help if I requested a manager, so I simply sucked it up and took my cold food back to the room. I would not recommend eating at this location. Not the true experience that I have come to expect from a company that I love.

This is my favorite theme restaurant everywhere- been to the Oahu (the most visited one), Maui, Anaheim, and San Francisco locations, and finally here! I was wondering when one of these would come to town- what took so long?! I'm a Landry Select Club member, so I can easily rack up more points for rewards (spend $250, get $25 in card credit).
