This one is located next to the Miracle Mile Shops, so here are your options: park at Valet at Todai or park at the Planet Hollywood's Miracle Mile Shops parking garage- enter the shopping center but exit out of the Todai side, and take the escalators or in our case, the elevator- we're parents now, so we're pushing a stroller. From here, a host will direct you. You will go through the store, into the elevator and up to the 3rd floor. From here, the host will seat you. It wasn't that busy, for lunch on a saturday, but then again, it's still new.   New, clean, featuring memorabilia from the movie, seems a little smaller compared to the other locations, but the ambiance feature is this one is overlooking the popular Strip. There were some patrons outside, but it was too cold for us, plus, our two-month old baby. There were some tables  with chairs and booths (the booth was too small for us- we had a stroller). I can't comment on the bathrooms since I didn't leave the table.   On to the food, the "Run Across America Sampler"- hush puppies, artichoke dip and chips, spicy chicken, fried shrimp, and peel 'n eat shrimp, is our absolute favorite. The price was $15.99, slightly higher than the last time but maybe the prices have gone up since then (last year- Oahu). This one never disappoints- we always split it. My husband really loves the hush puppies, it's his favorite. Mine is probably the chicken. I got the strawberry speckled lemonade at $5.99- refills are 99 cents. (Similar to Red Robin's lemonade.) The Ice Cream Caramel Spice Cake was phenomenal! This was $8.99, but well worth it. We've had the other ones in the past-  the bread pudding, strawberry shortcake, and the cookie sundae, but this one is specific to Las Vegas- it's new. I'm pretty sure we are getting this dessert again. It seems like a seasonal flavor combination, but really, you could have this all-year round. The server was really nice, and the service was pretty good, too. We got to ask the server questions about the movie. The manager stopped by to see how we were doing. He even changed out my wobbly chair.   My husband thinks that this takes away from when we go out of town, because we always include this place in our must-haves/must-eats, but I really like that it is finally here, where we live. I hope that this place does well. Las Vegas and certain restaurants do not always mesh (except mexican restaurants seem to pop up when space opens up). And I intend on getting a shirt at some point, even though I live here. We were pretty stuffed and needed to walk around the mall to get a little more comfortable.

I loved the theme of this restaurant, as a big fan of the movie Forest Gump I marveled when I walked in and felt I was on the boat they used to capture all those shrimps.   The service at this restaurant was great and everything we tried at this restaurant was of great quality.   I'm a big fan of sea food and if you are too ten definitely try this restaurant and get their halibut. We will definitely go back to this place. They all so have a fried combo basket with shrimp and fries which was amazing. As always I added the pics, so try this place and enjoy the fresh sea food, you won't be disappointed.  Also it's not extremely pricey as some of the joint in Vegas can be.

LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!  We were out one night on the strip and needed some place to eat. In our family we are all fans of seafood. I am personally a fan of Forrest Gump so this was a natural choice. As you walk in there is movie memorabilia everywhere. It makes you feel as though the events, and characters in the movie are real. It's a lot of fun. They have an awesome balcony area that overlooks the strip, or you can dine inside. Everything as far as food is fantastic. I can't elaborate on it too much because their really isn't any other way to put it. We were very pleased with everything. The service was awesome. Everyone involved was super friendly and attentive. One thing that we loved about this restaurant was that they have a little sign that you can flip when you need service. Then anyone walking by will stop and help you. It's awesome and super efficient.

The food was ok here. If you are a seafood lover this is not the place to come to. It wont be as good as you would expect a shrimp restaurant to be. I thought the kids meals were pretty cool though. The price here is ridiculous. Probably because they are on the strip. They had seating outside on a balcony which I would have liked to sit at but I had 3 kids with me so that wasn't really an option.

Closest parking is in Planet Hollywood. Too bad you have to walk all the way through Miracle Mile and then around the outside of PH and up the stairs, since the elevator was down, to get to it. There is a Walgreens close by that may let you park there, but I was not able to confirm that. I had the grilled seafood trio. My friend had the shrimp combo with grilled shrimp, tempura and coconut shrimp. Our server was very nice and attentive and had some funny trivia to ask. I don't like how they ask you to buy their gift card for all the other bubba gump's in the US. It seems like they have to go through their whole sales pitch before leaving. I would prefer if they said "Hey check out this pamphlet it explains our gift card, let me know if you want to purchase!" I am a local and it seems like the majority of the people were tourists. I had a good time. Thanks!

Really can't comment on the food here... But I can comment on the service around 4:30 pm on 7/16/16... Would give a half star if I could and that would be only for the girl that greeted us...  It was FUC'n horrible!!! We walked up, we were sat down next to the windows on the strip, and handed menus. And we sat. And then we sat some more. And then even more. Damn near 20 minutes of this $hit went on. Servers, (and when I say servers, I mean 4-5 at a minimum), walked by us, more than once, clearly saw our menus, (either open or after we had "made our choices", closed on the table top), without glasses of water in 105 degree heat. And not even a single one of them said absolutely anything to us like "Oh have you been helped"? "Would you like a glass of water"? "You're butt FUC'n ugly"... Something... Anything!!! THE only reason we waited as long as we did was because we were famished and felt like some Bubba Gump... We love the Shoreline Village location in the LBC.  Now, I have never been in the business of serving folks in a restaurant, or waiting tables for that matter, (unless you want to count working at Jack-in-the-Box as a teen), BUT I will say one thing... If I DID work in a joint like Bubba Gump AND saw patrons sitting for even 5 minutes without water, I would do one of two things:  1). Either offer them water, and get it to them myself, (even if it wasn't my table), or; 2). Tell the lame ass who WAS responsible for that table / area to get their $hit together and tend to their customers.  The place wasn't really even that busy.  Will never, EVER, waste my time and give that Hell Hole a shot at my dolla again.

Nothing spectacular at all.....  First after being seated for about 20 minutes we were finally greeted by our server who had walked past us several times already. We were then advised if we needed her assistance we needed to have the sign on red. Okay... How were we supposed to know. The food IMHO was okay but a bit expensive for what you get on your plate... The tea and fountain drinks were horrible as well....

Ok so! It was my brother in laws 30th birthday and I had never been to this restaurant and was so excited to try it! It was freezing cold outside and the strip was so so busy! It took us forever to find a parking spot which is fine we grew up here in Vegas so we are used to it but then walking through the entire casino/strip in the freezing cold it took us a good 45 minutes to locate the restaurant from the car. We were so incredibly excited when we saw the sign and realized that we were so close to some yummy shrimp and I was so excited to try this restaurant that everyone raves about, although it wasn't on a pier I was still super excited. The restaurant was due to close at 1am and we got there at 12:25, we had called earlier that day and asked if getting there by 12:30 would be okay because my husbands shift was not over until 11:30. We got there and the greeters immediately. with no smile at all, said we are closed. I actually laughed because I thought she was joking when she said that they were closed. Her face did not change so I know she was serious and we had just wasted all of our time, I asked her I thought you guys don't close until 1? and we even called and whoever we spoke with said it would be fine. She said "yeah we decided to close early tonight" She literally looked satisfied with disappointing me. I work in customer service and this is not okay. You are a business, and at that a BRAND NEW business on the strip! You cant just decided to close early unless an emergency and she said nothing of the sort. I really just couldn't believe that had just happened. Disappointed and doing everything possible to keep my mouth shut and keep my anger inside, we just walked away. There was also a gentlemen there too and he said "Come back and see us again soon" and again I laughed! I had such a ad experience that I honestly would rather drive 5 hours to the one in Santa Monica then go to this one!

Went here on a very nice day so we decided to sit outside. The patio view of the strip is awesome. What bothered me a little was how sticky the table was and the food was okay. I had the appetizer sampler that came with chips and dip (hardly ate it), buffalo chicken bites (alright), peel and eat shrimp (very bland), and fried shrimp which could of used a little more seasoning. My boyfriend had the lieutenant Dan's shrimp and that had well seasoned grilled shrimp. Overall, okay. Better shrimp at Red Lobster.
Bubba Gump shrimp is great. They have delicious varities of shrimp. Ribs are delicious, good drinks, friendly staff, great environment. yea buddy.

I live in the SF bay area but oddly enough I've never been to Bubba Gumps in our area. We were getting desperate and everything had a pretty long wait so we peeked in and there was no wait. The elevator was broken but one of their staff members helped us carry our stroller up the stairs. I got a seafood entre and the honey got ribs. He said the ribs were amazing. Mine was tasty but small portions. Our waiter was sweet. He checked on us constantly to ensure we were happy.

Ok this place is ok, just ok. The food is fine and the servers are very friendly. So here is what happened, the last tin=me I was there, there was a table of people clearly from their corporate office. All the staff were falling all over each other to wait on them hand and foot. The problem was that it was at the expense of the paying customers! (Yes I know all about the Stop Forest Thing) know let me be clear, I put the blame on the corporate people for fostering a culture where the staff felt they had to act like that. If the corporate people were there to check out the restaurant they should have lifted their heads out of their plates for 2 seconds and view the sight of all of the servers at their table and nowhere else. So stop there if you must but if you see a large table full of people with the entire wait staff around them: Run Forest Run! Live it up, you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

I'm not normally a big fan of chains, but I have to admit that I liked this restaurant. The theme is pretty cool if you've seen Forrest Gump and it's fun when they come around and ask trivia questions from the movie. The hushpuppies are my favorite item because they have seafood in them. I had the Shrimp New Orleans which was very tasty with the perfect amount of seasoning and tasty sauce. The portion was very generous as well. The only thing I wasn't a fan of was the chocolate chip cookie sundae because it didn't have a rich chocolate chip cookie taste. If you must get it at least share with someone else because it was way too much dessert for one person. They also have a cool gift shop with Forrest Gump merchandise.

The food was good, and the server got an A for effort. He was sweet, but he seemed a inexperienced. They do offer military discounts! A big plus was the bathrooms were really clean! Always good to find a clean bathroom in such a high traffic place.

We got the soup/salad combo (around $12), New Entree Catch, Coconut Shrimp and the Jambalaya dish; the latter three dishes were around $17-20 each. The presentation of the dishes had us salivating, but the food was just not it. It lacked flavor and freshness.   I personally love the movie "Forrest Gump", so I was really excited to try out this restaurant. But, the food fell way below my expectations. I don't know if it was just an off day for the chefs, but all the dishes were mediocre.   The restaurant is located on the second floor. You have to go up through the Bubba Gump merchandise store on the first floor to get to the restaurant. There wasn't much of a wait. We went on a Saturday evening.

Always has great shrimp but the reason I'm giving this 5 stars is our waiter. I believe his name was Charles or Charlie? He was an Asian guy. I want to be specific because he was absolutely fantastic. I wish I remembered his name because it was some of the best customer service. He checked in frequently, very nice, seemed nervous, and very apologetic when he forgot something or the wait. I payed with a gift card from my work that covered my meal but I wasn't able to tip. I didn't have cash and he didn't take my card. We tried waiting there for at least 15-20 min, we asked someone if they could find him, but after a while we left. If anyone sees this and knows who I'm talking about, I'm so sorry. You deserved the best tip. Thank you so much. You were fantastic. If we ever come back I hope you're our waiter again.

Came here to try the place for the first time.  I was disappointed in myself that I didn't get the reference to Forrest Gump right away...  I gave this place a 4 star because the food was amazing.  Each of the shrimp had a different texture.  Out of all the dishes though, the Jambalya was the best dish.  I like the amount of shrimp they provide as well.  I would have given the place a 5 star if not for the service.  The service was amazing before the food came, but as soon as food was on our table, we were just ignored.  We even tried to make sure to have the sign to indicate we needed service.  F.Y.I. They have a sign that indicates to "any" worker that you need service.  Our server said any worker will come and assist us, but in the end it was only that one server who kept coming.  I don't know why they say that any person will come and help when they clearly won't.  We had 2 or 3 workers not even turn an eye towards our table even when we needed help.  The only real downfall of this experience.

My family and I decided to try this place as "Forrest Gump" is one of our favorite movie.  We went there for dinner and although they were slightly busy, we were seated immediately.  Our waiter, Terry, gave us the menu and took our drink order right away.  We ordered the calamari and shrimp appetizers first.  The calamari was really good but the portion was not that much, the shrimp, however was of decent size.  We didn't wait long and our main entrees arrived.  The food was really great.  The staff were friendly and the place clean.  A lot of Forrest Gump memorabilia hung on the walls.  Terry was great, our empty plates were cleared immediately and he'd ask if everything was okay.  When we were all done eating,  we played a trivia about the movie, of course we answered all the questions correctly. Our overall experience at the restaurant is A+++.  We went to the gift shop afterwards and purchased some souvenirs .  The young lady who helped us was great and friendly as well. We will definitely eat at this place again and would recommend it to friends and family.

We were at Bubba Gump on July 3, 2014.  I thought it was pricey.  I think I paid $17 for a Creole shrimp dish but it was yummy!!  The service was excellent  and they were very nice.  If I go back to Vegas I would go there again.

First timer. Great Food! Got a bucket of shrimp that was delicious! Very noisy. Ordered a rum and coke from the bar and it was basically a cup full of ice. A little pricey. I was considering giving this place 3 stars but the shrimp was sooo damn good.

There is a true lack of customer service and tact at this restaurant.   We had an issue and asked to speak to a manager. Bud Koelle came to our table. We were using our golden nugget comps from Atlantic City. He said the system was unable to process the transaction.   I asked if he could call the property.  His comment was "I can't and won't call Atlantic City" I said you don't need to be rude. He said I'm not being rude you are rude.  I said wow so you insult your guest also. I handed him my credit card.   I noticed Bud Koelle copying information from my credit card.  I confronted him about this he said he was writing my name down I asked for my card back and he said he had not run the card yet.  It seems to be a security risk when an employee copies information from your credit card.   I have no clue what he was writing down.     I received a one question survey and comment box about my visit in an email.  I was truthful in my survey and received a phone call from the restaurant Asking me to change my score.  I was told that my score was based on my server and not management.   I was told that if I didn't change my score my survey would go into the servers file even though I had no issue with the server.

Me and my daughter went last night and the food was ok the service was different but what got me was they charged for drink refills !! Really?? It's not like its a cheap place to eat let's just say I won't be going back anytime soon maybe never

Alright drinks, good food & awesome bartender! Never been here before so wanted to try something new in Vegas. Menu has alot of options. I ordered the shrimp stuffed with crab and it was pretty good. Even the jasmine rice was delicious. My husband ordered the Catch entree and that was delicious! Well worth the $25! I ordered 2 diff mixed drinks and they both were weak :( My husband ordered the Metal margarita and that was weak too. The bartender Andrew started to chat with us for a while and he later made my husband a stronger margarita and that was a hit! Andrew kept checking up on us and chatting with us about everything so this made our dinner so much better. Taking off a star for the drinks being so expensive and weak but definitely worth trying out!
Good food and service. Very dependable although missed the trivia questions by server.

Before going to Bubba Gump, we read reviews to see how the food and service was. There were all sorts of reviews from five stars to one. We decided to go for it and we went. We sat on the balcony over looking the Las Vegas strip. Our server Charles attended to us. We had a great time and the food was delicious. We plan to go again in the near future. Don't forget to ask for Charles

This place is disgusting! I ordered one of their most popular dishes (shrimp New Orleans)  gross! It had a taste of dirt! I took my family here for their first time in Vegas and honestly I think there are much better places at a  fraction of the price! I was so disappointed and I wasn't the one paying a nearly $200 Bill.

I love this place!!! We had the peel and eat (spicy) shrimp... OMG!!! I wanted to eat my fingers because they had that sauce on them!!! Soooo yummy!!! We also got the cocktails that came with the souvenir glasses, a good deal... And I was in a weird mood for a cheeseburger.... One of the best burgers I can remember having!!! Great food and drinks, great service, great location and great ambiance!    Go, go, go!!!  OR 'Run, (insert your name here), RUN!' to this restaurant!

I ate here last night with my family and had a fantastic dining experience!  First off, there are a lot of stairs up to the restaurant (we didn't know at first that we could've taken the escalator from outside). We told one the employees that one of our family members couldn't make it up there that easily. So without hesitation, one of the waiters met us at the Bubba Gumps gift shop and led us to the employee elevator then escorting us past the kitchen (kinda cool to see) to our table.  Loved the vibe of the restaurant plus we had an awesome waiter too. It was cool the waiters play trivia with your table even though I haven't seen the movie myself. I ordered the appetizer, Cajun shrimp with garlic bread, and a side of fries to share. That ended up being the perfect portion size for me. The shrimp was delicious in the garlic sauce especially once you add the hot sauce for some spice! Fries were good as well.  I definitely would recommend this place and will be back!!

Bubba Gump Shrimp and Co. did not disappoint. The "Standing O" cocktail was great, the food was great, and the service was amazing. Our server Colin was very knowledge and gave some great advice for drinks and food. The shrimp Mac and cheese was really good. I am usually very critical of this dish and it satisfied my palette. The Forrest Gump memorabilia was awesome and fun. It is a little pricey, but the food and great service made it worth it.I would definitely return!  PS - correction "Shrimp Mac and Cheese"...my pic says lobster

Great place to eat while in Vegas! It's affordable, service is fun, and the food is pretty good for what it is!  I recommend coming here before the turn up! Go for their popular sampler which has fries, shrimp, and these hush puppy type fried balls. It's legit for $18.

I try to avoid eating at chains while on vacation, but I was in the mood for shrimp for some reason.  No wait. Awesome server who also worked in the bar. Ordered the Coronita Rita. It was so good. Not a fan of the sweetness of margaritas, but the mini Corona really balances out the sweetness. I ended up having 2 of them. Ordered the shrimp New Orleans. Thought it was delicious. Almost went back again during the trip
The owner emailed and the Manager called me.  Hopefully things will get better.  It has potential, i believe customer service is everything.

I'm familiar with Bubba Gump Shrimp Co., particularly their Makati branch. The decorations and designs are pretty much the same sans the UNLV memorabilia near the bar. Walk past the Miracle Mile shops and Planet Hollywood until you reach the staircase at the intersection (next to the Cosmopolitan if you're on the other side); you will see the BG entrance at the top.  Watermelon Lemonade ($10): Easy, breezy, lemoneezy. The drinks are currently being served in light-up glasses that you can take home with you. I couldn't really taste the watermelon, as it was more tangy and lemony, but it was good. I'd probably order a strawberry lemonade next time, though.  Hush Puppies ($10.29): Chunks of shrimp, fish, and corn mixed, battered, and deep fried served with their house remoulade on the side. Each hush puppy was bite sized and quite flavorful with or without the sauce.  Cup of Gumbo ($5.99): I found the gumbo to be pretty flavorful; you can taste the andouille sausage, shrimp, green onions, and spices all blended together. It isn't too thick, but it was definitely not watery either.   Shrimper's Heaven ($22.99): This was my choice, and I found it to be pretty good. You get four types of shrimp--tempura, golden, coconut, and grilled--with fries in each basket and three sauces--Tangy Asian, Cajun Marmalade, and Zesty Cocktail. Of all the types of shrimp, the grilled one was my least favorite; it is flavorless even with the sauces. Speaking of sauces, the Tangy Asian flavor doesn't stick to the shrimp.   We also ordered a bowl of Clam Chowder ($7.99), Bourbon Street Mahi Mahi ($20.49), Captain's Fish and Chips ($16.99), and Strawberry Lemonade ($5.99/ea and $0.99/refill). I did not try the Mahi Mahi, but it was said to be flavorful. The fish and chips were good--the fish was nice and flaky--but at its price, the serving is too small. As for the clam chowder, it was nothing special; it's not bland, but more of a "light" chowder. I forgot her name, but the waitress that was in charge of my group's table was awesome; service was fantastic.

Bubba Gump Shrimp has arrived in Vegas! Last Saturday, I arrived on the Strip to dine in Bubba Gump.        I have been to Bubba Gump Shrimp as a tourist in New Orleans and Chicago. I had been waiting for the grand opening of their Las Vegas vacation. Last Saturday the wait was over.      Bubba Gump Shrimp is located in the new mall that opened up on the northeast corner of Las Vegas Boulevard at Harmon Avenue in the shadow of Planet Hollywood. It is a second level tenant with pedestrian traffic from  two strip pedestrian overpasses. Currently it is easy to find because a lady is advertising it to passersby. At the entrance is the menu. I appreciate it when restaurants have the menu at the entrance. I prefer to have an idea of what I want to order before I step inside a restaurant. Once we decided what to order,entered through the edge of the Bubba Gump Shrimp Gift Shop. The woman greeter nicely directed us upstairs. Once upstairs, we were directed to stand on a cue of circles in a waiting area of the restaurant proper. If you have waited to ride on Disney Land's Star Tour's ride, this is a similar arrangement. Inside the restaurant, there is a spectacular view of the Cosmopolitan. When the weather is nice, the balcony seats overlooking the Cosmopolitan is a prime dining spot. The weather was cool and we sat in the general Forest Gump themed dining area.     If you have never been to Bubba Gump Shrimp, they have a neat gimmick. On the table is a sign that you flip. If you want service, I believe you set it to "Stop Forest" and if you don't need service, I believe you set it to "Run Forest Run."     If I was in vacation state of mind, I would of spent $21.99 on the Shrimper's Heaven. I was in a budget state of mind. Bubba Gump Shrimp is a reasonable option if you are on a budget on the Strip. I ordered the Shrimp Po' Boy sandwich with fries and bottomless Coke. After a tip, the dinner came to $22. Not bad!     I have a minor complaint, which is the waitress up selling a restaurant card. When the waitress sat next to us, my instinct was that she was not a die hard Forest Gump fan that wanted to share with the world that Forest Gump played football and that he was from Alabama. When I am eating out, I do not care if Forest Gump was wearing no sneakers in a scene or that football was a sport he played. I want to relax! By the time I am eating I have passed enough people in the hotels trying to sell me time shares. Fast forward to when we were walking out, they were advertising sales at the gift shop. In other respects, the waitresses were friendly and served with an urgency.     Most likely I will return to Bubba Gump. If I am in a tourist state of mind, I will relive my past vacations with Bubba Gump's Shrimper's Heaven.

Go for the food and service...stay and drink looking at the incredible view.  Bubba's is a casual dinning experience with a Five Star view adding the feel of a very special experience.  My Cocount Shrimp could not have been better and my husband ate every piece of his Gumbo.  He said the spice kick was just the right amount.  When the dish came and he saw how much was there he thought he could never finish -- but kept playing the "just one more taste" until it was all gone!
Good food, good service. Had a nice Cesar salad with grilled shrimp and a refreshing frozen margarita. I also tried the finger licking Cajun shrimp very delicious.

There are a ton of places to eat in Vegas, Bubba Gump happened to be on our list because they have an outside balcony patio that we could sit at and look over the strip and my sister has never been here before. When we first got here the customer service was fantastic, everyone is smiling as they greet you and show you the way to be seated. After hiking up some stairs and walking for a bit, alas the hostess to seat us! We were sat within 5 minutes and greeted by our waiter. The drinks here are WAY over priced and the food was bleh....... the drinks were very weak and cost us about $16 each for one regular mixed drink in a regular sized glass, a beer was $13...... ouch! The food was very bland and just...... well bleh. No taste, no flavor, no yummy to it at all. I remembered the Bubba Gump in SF being WAY BETTER! Definitely disappointed in this visit. Along with the cheap food and expensive drinks came panic at the end of our meal. I paid with a $100 bill and made sure I told the waitress it was a $100 bill, she brought be back change as if I paid with a $50, then disappeared. After talking to 2 other waiters, they finally found my original waitress and she pulled the rest of my change out of her coin purse, her actual personal coin purse and said "oh im sorry I must have counted that wrong, let me get you change from my tips" its ok to miscount money I understand, but why would you have put it in your personal bag and not in the cash register, and why would you be paying me back in your tips!??? I didn't say keep the change and leave you a large tip..... so why wasn't I given exact change? So that was weird and not fun, the whole dinner was just disappointing, time consuming (for service was super slow) and having to hunt for my money back is just a pain.  Spend your money and time somewhere else!

Had it not been for the amazing customer service, this place would have had three or four stars. However, our server Carlos earned them a top rating.   I don't eat shellfish of any kind. But my husband was craving shrimp and we'd been wanting to check this place out since the "coming soon" sign first appeared. I wish they had more variety to choose from for non-shellfish eaters. But our server not only made suggestions of what I could eat, he went out of his way to modify one of the dishes for me, making sure to substitute the sauce for one that wasn't shellfish-based. The food itself was pretty tasty, but nothing extraordinary. If it wasn't for the best customer service Vegas has to offer, we would keep this on our "maybe return to" list. But it will definitely be one of our go-to spots now.

Would never go back do to the rudeness of the management had to wait for drinks do that one employee didnt come to work. Not my fault then a mistake an the check when you get your glass was getting refused to get the glass and when dont eatting but the sign down to stop.  And ask to clean the table so we could drink are drinks person was very rude and rolled her eyes at us for the cost and the rudeness i never go back here in vegas  Now san fransco i go bact to that one stay away from the one here in vegas

Good, but not as good as the hype. Still, the service was excellent and the pricing was more than fair considering the location on the Vegas strip. The air condition was good also, a big heal when it's 109 degrees out.

Love Bubba Gump! I have been to multiple locations, San Francisco, Santa Monica, Las Vegas, Laughlin, you name it. No matter where you go, you get the same excellent service. Jumbalaya is a must. Great selection of food. Their drink "menu" is not something I'm a fan of, just too fruity and sweet. I stick to my regular drinks off the menu or beer. This specific location has a great seating outside, literally on the strip, just beautiful.

If you ever wonder what Forest Gump did after his military tour you need to check this place out. Interestingly quirky with license plates with "Run Forrest Run" or "Stop Forrest!" that you show to get the waiter's attention.   Gulf coast style cuisine with more types of shrimp than I knew existed. Tasty food with eye appeal that is served hot. Large assortment of alcoholic drinks to chose from.

Came her on my fist visit to Vegas in February and I gotta say I expected waaaay better. I got the salmon and it was he worst. My fiance at the time now my husband, got the something (i cant remember) that was just as bad. Bad choice and wont visit again.

My family and I were greeted by the hostess and seated immediately (there was no wait, which was a plus because we were very hungry after a long morning exploring the Strip). Our waiter was very friendly. He took our orders and our food came quickly. We ordered the Accidental Fish & Shrimp, Net Catch Entree, and an extra order of fries. The food was tasty but the portions were a bit light for the amount of money you pay. As we were leaving the employee in the gift shop was also very nice. He asked us how we enjoyed our meal and made small talk with our family. So great customer service there as well.  As far as the establishment, the  it was clean, including the restrooms. Overall we had a great experience here and look forward to returning.
I really like the SF one, the service was boring and the salads were bland. Won't be coming back

Always a full house. If you utilize the "Run Forrest" or "Stop" signs, it can be hit or miss depending on the servers. I've noticed service is getting better at this location which I totally appreciate. The food is flavorful. Not too many healthy options, mostly fried options, so if you're watching what you eat or on a diet, be prepared to be let down or tempted. There are a lot of fun drink options if you want to hang out at the bar.
Love the gumbo and skewered shrimp , our server Bryant was awesome!   Will stop by next time in town.
One of the best bubba Gump places! Fast and warm service, attentive servers..-:) food is great and I always love their Forest Gump themed interior...amazing!

Very mediocre food for being so pricey. A 2 person meal will run you about $90 for 2 entrees, appetizer and 1 drink each. We could've ate at a nice steak restaurant for that price. Also $15 for a cocktail that tasted watered down. I ordered the chicken. Nothing special about it. KFC style.

I took a trip to Las Vegas,  for a few days,  and let me say this.  If you do not have a Bubba Gump's near you,  then this a must stop!!!!   Let me start off by saying their drinks are A1!  I mean I can not complain at all.  I ordered a Peach Colada which I believe is off the seasonal  menu,  one item that seemed like a shrimp ceviche,  for me dinner I order a shrimper's heaven,  and a sampler dessert.  I really wanted to try some of the best of everything.  Now I must admit this dinner did cost a bit more than what I was expecting to spend but was it worth it absolutely.   Now my waitress was definitely fun,  we had a few laughs,  We never went without anything.  I will definitely eat here anytime I am on a trip due to the fact we don't have one here in Dallas.

Craving seafood and we decided to stop in here .. I'd been before so I know it's a chain but this visit the food wasn't great..   Service was great.. they explained the run & stop signs on the table and the one time we used it a server stopped right away to answer our question ..   We got our drinks right away and our orders came out pretty quickly..   My food looked really good .. small serving size but that cheese sauce on the bourbon Mah mahi dryed up and resembled cheez whiz (no bueno) the crispy fried chips were cold those were definitely sitting out and added to the plate as a decoration.. shrimp was good (I could've eaten a plate of those and been happy!)  My bf ordered Jennys catch with lobster butter sauce .. that sauce with potatoes was delicious!   Overall service was a great.. but food was a miss on this visit.
I'm not a seafood person but I tried some of my friend's shrimp and fries and it was really good. Great flavor, not too bready. Good.

First time with my sweetie in Vegas without the kids and we choose this restaurant because of its location and we were not disappointed!  It was beautiful!  Our waitress rocked it and took great care of us.  Food was to die for!  We will be going back on our next get away!
I ordered the shrimp and grits very attentive staff. My wife had the mahi mahi very tasty

Drowsy.com . . . Nothing to brag about here folks. This is your sub standard chain restaurant. The hostess was rude. I had to speak to him twice before he acknowledged our party of 6 standing at the hostess stand. I ordered the Alabama steampot. My potatoes we undercooked, shrimp was over cooked, and apparently Cajun means dump paprika all over the food but no salt. Blah. Save your time, money and calories. Not worth it.

This restaurant is not open until 1am on Friday as shown here.  The manager said the kitchen closes at 12, so if you are looking for a late night place to eat, go elsewhere.  I told the employees at the front about it being advertised on the web site as being open until 1am and they said "We have a web site?"  Stupid is as stupid does!!!

The first night we were in Las Vegas,  my husband and I had dinner here.  Food was reasonably priced. There is outdoor or indoor seating.  I had the Shrimp stuffed with crabmeat and my husband had Shrimp Scampi.  Both were excellent and reasonably priced. Servings were very filling. It was also nice to be able to sit outside and be able to have a view of Las Vegas Strip.

Incredible experience! I absolutely adore all the detailed decor!! The mason jars were the coolest souvenir ever in addition you can receive a new cup in exchange for your used one when exiting the resturant! The food was okay and the service was excellent! Highly recommend for a dining experience! Thanks Abby for all your recommendations and personalizing our experience! 8/20/13

Great location, glad this place is finally open.  As a single diner, I sat at the bar.  I ordered a shrimp po boy with the fries.  This sandwich was huge.  In fact, the sandwich was served open faced as it was so large. The shrimp is deep fried and good, though not great.  Could use some southern seasoning. The fries are just typical.  I figured, if I am going to get full eating this meal, I am taking down the sandwich and avoiding the fries. Glad I did, I was stuffed by the time I finished the sandwich.  My waiter/bartender was Korey. Very nice guy. Good service and friendly. After my meal, I took a walk around the restaurant.  Great decor of Forrest Gump memorabilia, as in all Bubba Gump restaurants.  Went out to the balcony and there is a nice view of the Strip.
Good service, horrible food. Fried chicken had NO flavor, gravey not good, and corn came out with silk all over it.  Spinach dip was good.  Not worth the money!

Today my friends and I decided to eat here as it was my friends first time to Vegas.. unfortunately my first five minutes in this establishment were completely ruined by the hostess or manager Sarah. Before arriving I had purchased a Slushy type drink at the Paris hotel.  As my friends and I started to walk up the stairs to enter the restaurant Sarah just pointed at me and basically says I can't come in with an open container. I understand that this is the restaurants policy but her entire approach made me not even want to come back. She was very rude and dismissive. As a former manager I wouldn't dream of speaking to anyone like how she did today.  First impressions are everything , especially if the first person you are interacting with is rude as hell. Won't be visiting this establishment, I'll go to one back home Thanks.

Bubba Gumps is one of my favorite seafood restaurants in Vegas if I want something on the strip with friends.  I love, LOVE, love shrimp and can't get enough of it here.    The casual environment is great for a lunch spot and I've even came here just for apps and drinks.  In addition to seafood, they have a great variety of salads, deserts, and awesome style baby back ribs.     My favorite is just the traditional margarita and they will even hand-shake it right at your seat. Bonus :)
I've been to this particular restaurant a few times and i always seat by the patio, the view is really really beautiful specially at night. I always order the BLT shrimp salad! OMG its soooo yummy!
Honestly not good at all. Was cold when I got it and didn't taste good at all. Everything is fried and the batter isn't even good. Won't be going to Bubba Gump's again any time soon.

Ok... The shrimp and fries were ok but the fish was not cooked all the way. The batter that they used wasn't even done all the way. The hush puppies were rather Interesting because they had corn and shrimp in the middle of them. It's was new for me and it was great. The service was outstanding because they had a License plate on the table that indicated run forest run, for the waiter to know that we didn't need anything. The other plate indicated stop forest stop for the waiter to stop at the table to see what we wanted.  Overall, I should of found a chicken joint to go to in Vegas. I would of spent less and and been  more happier. That meal I got with two soft drink was 30 bucks. I  Took a financial hit going here.

We enjoyed this location a lot. You can request to be seated on the balcony (if weather is nice) and watch the craziness of the Las Vegas Strip. Our food was pretty good, the clam chowder and the shrimp pasta. The chowder has nice flavor and plenty of chunks of clam. The pasta was done perfectly with lots of wonderful capers for every bite. Prices were not too bad considering it is on the Strip where they want to charge you $20+ for a hamburger. The real treasure of our visit to this restaurant was the service. From the time we were greeted until we left the staff treated us like friends. Our server, Zuri, might be one of the nicest people in the world. I would go here again, absolutely. Menu has a lot of fried and high carb dishes but also some more sensible fare.

I've heard so much about this place but was not impressed at all. Perhaps it's what I ordered ( stuffed shrimp) very mediocre served with white plain bland rice. Pear strawberry salad was better. Very meh. Waitperson was very nice and upbeat.
Randomly came in for dinner and couldn't be happier! The food was great and my server "meshell" was great! Really funny girl and was always making sure we were ok. Coming back soon

Glad they finally have one in Vegas!  So when you get to the hostess, they ask you "So what did Jenny tell forest to do? RUN FOREST RUN!" I thought they were going to make us run to our table..So that was uncomfortable, not expecting pop trivia. So after we get seated they explain the stop and go sign to us. Love it, because EVERYONE stops to help, not just waiting on your server..  So server comes back with food and before we get to eat, we have to answer 3 more questions about the movie.. I was a bit annoyed because if you don't know the answer you kinda feel stupid.. even with trick questions like "What was the name of Forest's dog?" He didn't have one..  I think next time, I am going to lie and say I never seen the movie.. Less questions. I am such a party pooper I know.   Food is what I come for, which is always good. I walked out like I just ate a buffet, which only was the Shrimp mac and cheese lol.

We've eaten here a couple times when in Vegas and this last time was the best.  We had Forrest's Seafood Feast and the New Orleans Shrimp.  The New Orleans Shrimp is best if you mix everything up into the sauce when you get it.  The pineapple margarita was great and they give you a shaker to keep re-filling so it makes 3 margaritas total.  Service was great and we were seated right away for a Thursday evening dinner.

Perfect view on the patio, located near Planet Hollywood.  Had a signature drink that was  good and came with a souvenir shaker. Shared appetizers and especially loved  the "Run Forest " on the table.

This was our first visit to any Bubba Gumps, and we loved it. Great portions for price, perfectly seasoned!  Wish there was a larger selection of fish options, without the shrimp.  Beautiful strip view outside, we were lucky with cooler weather on our visit. Wait staff was friendly, quick, and reliable.  Will defenitely return again!
The atmosphere, the food, and the service was excellent. Everything I could have ever wanted in a themed restaurant.

If I could give ZERO STARS, I would. If you absolutely love seasoned salt (I mean not being able to discern fries from seafood by the taste), this is the place for you. I was wondering why this place had no line/no wait on New Years Eve! I found out after the first bite. This place is the worst. The service is really sad as well. You literally have to wave down people to get their attention. This place can be compared to a franchise Applebee's at best! Save your time and money and stay away from here!

It's basic. Nothing super special but it's a good lunch or dinner if you know what you want. No surprises. Although I guess if you're in Vegas you might wanna try something special to the place rather than a chain

Food was excellent I got the crab stuffed shrimp.  Bar tenders were more than helpful, friendly, and personable.  The strawberry lemonade thing I got was outstanding.  It was a tad pricey, but not that bad.  Bar booths were missing seats which looked really tacky. Nice souvenir shop down stairs.

I was fooled to think that this place is just for tourists. I was so wrong! If my German cousin wasn't visiting Vegas with me I'd never step into a Bubba Gump. But man I missed out!  The restaurant is very themed and staff is friendly. Now their food - definitely exceeded my expectations!  Of course we have scampi - one of the best scampi dish I've tried in my life. And I've been to 12 counties in the world including Italy.  Jenny's Catch - the tilapia melts in your mouth! The butter sauce is so (fat) but good! With some spinach and mashed potato to top it off.  Gumbo - the only thing I didn't like at this dinner. Strangely this is one of their customer-favorites. Just isn't for me I guess.

The service was AWESOME!!!  The food was superb!!! We had the shrimp scampi, dumb luck coconut shrimp, and shrimp mac & cheese. Everything arrived promptly and tasted perfectly. I really recommend this place.  Our server was Lydia and she was extremely pleasant.

This location doesn't carry the same atmosphere as other Bubba locations primarily because it's not on or near a beach. The food is similar and staff is friendly but awesome that they have one in the desert of Las Vegas.

Wenn einem die Warme Luft nichts ausmacht, dann sollte man sich auf den Balkon setzen, dort hat man dann einen schönen Blick auf den Strip!  Das Essen dort ist nicht gerade billig, aber dafür bekommt man was sehr leckeres!  Das Team von Bubba Gump dort ist sehr nett und nicht zu aufdringlich!

Maybe it's because I'm from the south, but nothing was seasoned, Shrimp was disgusting.... Would never recommend this place. We had to send 4 meals back and my friends steak was not medium well...he received a new one and it still was not up to par.... Will not be going back.  -Janelle
Had a wonderful time. We were seated right away, my son picked outside. Nice view of the strip. Our waiter was very attentive and the food was amazing! Very family friendly.

Frankly, I can't rate the food because after twenty (20) minutes of waiting for someone to take a drink order, or even be welcomed, we walked out.  There were at least a dozen empty tables in the restaurant.  Do yourself a favor, go to any of the 15 restaurants nearby who want to earn your business.

I really wanted to try this place because I love shrimp and I loved the movie.  When you walk it, it's just the gift shop. You have to walk up a couple of flights of stairs to get to the restaurant.  Here's what I liked about this place. The ambience. Great service and helpful staff. We got seated on the patio which had a great view of the Strip. Really cool idea to have signs on your table to let staff know when you need them: Run Forrest Run or Stop Forrest Stop. The waiter asked us trivia about Forrest Gump, which kinda stumped us. Here's what I didn't like about this place: The Food.  It sucked. We ordered the Frizzled Onion Rings for an appetizer.  Frizzled is right; the breading came off easily, it was just skinny onions. We both ordered Forrest's Seafood Feast, which were told it was the most popular. It consists of Fried Shrimp, Fish and Chips with their special hushpuppies. The shrimp was average at best. The "fish" was awful. Very thin strips of heavily breaded fish.  I've had better fish sticks.  The hushpuppies were ok, they had corn inside, but they were small. Considering the price of this menu, the food does not reflect it. The only thing that prevented me from giving one star was the "experience". If you are a Forrest Gump fanatic, you'll love this place. Maybe just stick to drinks though.
great service. if you're looking for shrimp this is the spot! Po boy is a solid solid sandwich! shrimp n grits or also excellent.

I ordered two different entrees and really wasn't satisfied with my meal. The food wasn't nasty or anything...just wasn't satisfied. Overrated and overpriced. I was also expecting shrimp and grits and it wasn't on the menu.

I never saw Forrest Gump so this place was sorta lost on me.  I've seen it in Orlando and New York but never ventured until this las Las Vegas trip.  The restaurant is peppered with movie paraphernalia and the waiters engage customers with Forrest Gump trivia, it was fun and the answers were all around you.    Ordered shrimp macaroni & cheese - very salty, probably the breadcrumbs. The pasta was cheesy and shrimp spicy.    The grilled fish and vegetables was tasty and the fried fish, shrimp and seafood/shrimp hush puppies were crispy and good.    Watermelon lemonade was refreshing.  Received Bubba Gump souvenir glasses from gift shop - added treat.

Las Vegas! Great service I had the fish and chips it was excellent the waiter was great, very courteous.  I also had the bread pudding it was outstanding!!! I had the blueberry lemonade......very good!!! Everything was good , very delicious.  So I will definitely come back

I was warned that this restaurant wasn't the best, but my guy and I were hungry so we decided to try it out anyway.  Big mistake...I wasn't at all impressed!    I ordered from the menu (take-out) the "Net Catch Entrée" - Beer steamed Peel 'n' Eat Shrimp, along with Carrots, Celery, Corn, Potatoes and Andouille Sausage all steamed and tossed with Garlic Spice or our Secret Cajun Spice recipe for $22.99.  I chose the Cajun spice seasoning without the Andouille sausage.  The shrimp was cooked perfectly, but it didn't have the Cajun flavor I was expecting and was use to and the corn on the cob were hard as a rock, so I couldn't eat them.    My babe ordered the "Forrest's Seafood Feast" - Hand breaded Fried Shrimp, Fish & Chips and Seafood Hush Pups. Served with Fries and dippin' sauces, Tartar, Cocktail and Remoulade for $20.99.  He said he enjoyed it, so maybe I just ordered the wrong thing.  Overall, I was disappointed.  For the price I expected WOW...but, instead got BLAH!

The manager, Sarah, had attitude and a fake smile... She was very concerned about respecting restaurant policy. We were two who arrived early out of a party of 6 and everyone was on their way. She would not seat us even if the restaurant was EMPTY. I pointed out to her that the rest of the group was minutes away, that the restaurant was empty and that we had come early because my mom wanted to eat right away. She said no because of POLICY. At this point, I would have left but the rest of the group were almost here. Terrible customer service... Please note I rarely complain about service, but this was unacceptable... To be left waiting in an empty restaurant on a weekday afternoon!  As for the food, bad tasteless greasy chain food. And they charge for bread. Please stay away... So many better options on the Strip. On a positive note, the staff in their store was very nice and helpful.

For starters the welcoming staff was very  friendly! My server was friendly and attentive as well, the food had good taste nice and fresh, nice presentation. Strawberry lemonade best I've had. I gave it four stars for the friendly attentive service.   I was  also impressed by cleanliness of the restroom. This was the cleanest bathroom I have ever seen in any restaurant, BIG UPS HIGH-FIVES TO THE STAFF AT BUBBLE GUMPS LAS VEGAS STRIP LOCATION...
Service here is really bad here tonight we are here still  waiting on service. The servers are off near the washroom arguing in the open at least 6 of them.
Never disappoints!  No matter what location you go to.. good food, good drinks, good service.. GREAT MEMORIES!

My partner is a huge Forrest Gump fan so I knew I had to take him to this place! I was a little worried looking at the reviews, but I had nothing to worry about!   The service was great and fast. We ordered the popcorn shrimp, shrimp salad and the shrimpers heaven. Everything was cooked to absolute perfection!   Next time we'll definitely just order a heap of the coconut shrimp and we done with it!   Expensive but tasty, not a complaint of the entire meal!

Food was alright and very very very overpriced. It was ridiculous. I am still shocked that I paid $6 for a non alcoholic beverage, their strawberry lemonade! Its a nice atmosphere and our server was very nice and attentive but the taste of the food and the prices just don't add up. I will go back though to try their shrimp po boy which I saw someone else get. It was pretty big and only cost $13. Other than that they wouldn't see me there for awhile.

Love the awesome interior design!  The service was just okay.   The food was just okay.  We orders garlic bread and fried shrimp and fries.  You cannot go wrong with fried stuffs. LOL!!    Garlic shrimp was too salt but good salty.  Garlic bread $5.99.   Fried shrimp $21.99.  And garlic shrimp $14.99

I've been to Gatlinburg and New Orleans but had Bubba Gump in Vegas. It was ok. I thought the decor was very well done and the Run and Stop signs work really well.   The food wasn't anything spectacular, but my boyfriend's food was better than my choice. Process are decent and service was good. Our waitress came over and gave us some Forrest Gump trivia questions, which we got all right. I thought we were going to win something though, lol.    I wouldn't make any special trips back to BG, but I wouldn't oppose to going of anyone wanted to try it.

We loved coming here when we used to live in HI. Just that Bubba Gump vibe and decor, open air, looking towards the Pacific ocean, and the smell of.food being prepared as Tradewinds brush through.  Crap, we aren't in HI. This location lacked, alot. Our server was lousy, unattentive, and you could see him by their register thingy playing as if it's social hour. The Bubba Gump we once loved and wished we had out here, had arrived, minus the Bubba Gump.vibe we are acquainted with.   My husband always gets the Shrimp New Orleans. I'll usually order a Caesar salad (surprise surprise), their salmon, or their ribs. I will say I have always loved their Caesar salad. Their Caesar dressing and croutons have always been on point, so I can't critique that.  I feel like their ribs for $24 is not even worthed. It isn't even that great. It's good, just not 24 bucks good. On this particular evening I ordered salmon. Can we say, dry! DRY! Look, I am those weirdos who actually can bare through dry food, love my steak charred and well-done...chewy? No problem. If I accidentally overcook my salmon at home, I can bare with it. BUT when a restaurant serves you a dry fish at 20 bucks....grrrr.   It isn't a bad place to try. Maybe it's a hit or miss. But I just think they are way too steep for what you are getting. Also, the service we received was pretty lousy. I can seperate lousy service and good food or vice versa. On this night, wholly cow. I mean, from the long anticipated wait just to get our name called, to the walk uo the stairs just to stand in another line to get seated...It just all sucked.  Our waiter got no tip whatsoever and I seriously regretted going there with the whole brood.  Oh, forgot to mention..the husband enjoyed his dish (surprise surprise).   I came in with a stroller and had no problems. Just the part where we had to carry the stroller up the stairs. I could've swore I seen an elevator, so it would have been customer service friendly if someone mentioned it. However, my husband and I like to move quick...so carrying that bad boy up the stairs toddler strapped in was the only option even if there were other options.  Definitely kid and stroller friendly! I won't HIGHLY recommend it. There are other GREAT restaurants in the area to spend your money where you will receive better service and a well-worthed meal. But, I don't like my isolated experience to deter other from trying it out.   However, because of the service we received that night, quality of food, the price...only way I'd come back to THIS Bubba Gump is if someone gave me a gift certificate...only then will I give it another shot and only hope to up its ratings.

Fabulous food and service. The environment is very fun and lots of cool memorabilia from the Forrest Gump movie. The servers also come up and do movie trivia and quizzes  while waiting makes it fun and interesting. I have the Alabama steam pot Cajun style and it was DELICIOUS. Lots of shrimp and other delicious seafood. Very reasonable prices and lots of food.

After receiving an extremely rude "compliment" on my yelp review from employee Jessica L., I would like to repeat it was closed at 3:30 PM on a Saturday, for absolutely NO reason. WE EVEN ASKED WHY they were closed, we were answered with "I don't know, I'm really sorry" They didn't say one word about it being veterans day (the reason Jessica L. Gave me via Yelp 3 months later) So your rude employee can keep her yelp responses to her self! I was in Vegas specifically FOR Veterans Day, with 4 Veterans! We would have said ok great, had we been given an answer! BTW miss priss I came in the next day and spent 120$ on 4 plates so f*** off!

From the outside it looks like is a great place to eat and dine at but in reality it was not all that great, overrated. Horrible customer service took about 20 minutes to get our table some drinks. Many employees walking around and was never asked if everything was ok or to take our order and took about another 30- 45 minutes to finally get our food. Definitely not going back to Bubbas when I go to Vegas again.  Oh and did I mention the forks were dirty?. had to ask for CLEAN set of utensils smh

I went here Sunday afternoon. The decor was nice. I love the pics and movie phrases and a lot of other stuff. The food presentation was nice. My friend ordered the gumbo which she enjoyed. Also the peel and eat shrimp. Which she didn't like. I tasted one and let me tell u it was bland. I am a Cajun/creole sauce fanatic and this was not. Bubba is turning over in his grave. I had the spinach artichoke and shrimp dip which was awful and bland. I took a few bites and they happily took it off my bill. I also had the shrimp skewers that were beautiful but bland. Service was outstanding. Hostess very nice and welcoming and waiter was very attentive. I live in L.A. and go to the one on the Santa Monica Pier. The food is better there

The food was great, we had no wait time on a Friday night and our server jayson was entertaining and kind. Other team members step in the assist servers if the restaurant gets busy and you can tell its customers are a priority. A definite must if you adore Forest Gump!

This is my 3rd visit to a Bubba Gump, and my 1st visit to the Vegas location.  First of all, kudos to the servers. They were certainly on point! Everyone helped out each other and were very professional. Thank you for our awesome customer service!  The restaurant is located on the top floor of where the Miracle Mile shops are. Very easy to get to and accessible from the strip.   Our table of 8 (gratuity already included) placed different orders, but I made out with the cup of gumbo and the Stuffed Shrimp (stuffed with crab). My gumbo was OK. I haven't had a gumbo as good as the gumbo from NOLA unfortunately.   My shrimp entree ($20) was soooo rich and buttery. WOW, such great flavor! I also tried my Dad's jambalaya and it was spicy! Drink lots of beer!!! I also tried the coconut shrimp, which I enjoyed as well. I had a tempura shrimp and I didn't care for it. There was a weird taste that accompanied it.   The drinks/cocktails are expensive so expect to pay an arm and a leg for them! I had a Corona and that went well with our savory entrees. We were all so stuffed for dessert.   Fun place to catch a meal. I love all the Forrest Gump memorabilia!

I feel robbed. Everyone had a decent experience.   Tuesday night with my stepson and boyfriend in July for dinner. We were seated in 10 minutes which wasn't bad. It was inside even though we asked for outside, since we wanted the great view. Then our waitress started off strong getting our order & answering menu questions. Then we never saw her again!! Thank god for the stop and go sign or we would have just sat there. I ordered a drink and had to remind them twice to bring it. And never got it. The food wasn't that great and over priced for the small portions, which is typical of the strip. No trivia which I was looking forward to since my stepson just saw the movie.   I am a local and my boyfriend works on the strip and we both will never recommend this place to anyone.

Get the shrimp basket! It is a bit pricey ~$21 but I think you get a good selection of shrimps that they offer. It comes with coconut shrimp, tempura shrimp, cooked cold shrimp, regular fried shrimp, and some French fries. Also, my favorite sauce is the pineapple sweet and sour sauce! Try to ask for more sauce because I felt that you need more.   I also got the shrimp gumbo for ~$6. It was really spicy and had barely any shrimp. I honestly don't recommend it because it was spicy and hot.   The place is also on the second floor because the first floor is their gift shop.   Overall, I feel that most of their food was pricey for shrimp but if you want to taste good cooked shrimp the. Go here! Also, the gift shop is a good souvenir place for tourists!

We decided to stop by becuz we were craving seafood. Since we were walking around the strip, we had our drinks with us (just like everyone else lol) When we walked in the bubba gumps, the hostess told us we couldn't walk in with our drinks. We told her "really? But we're in Vegas & everyone has drinks!" She said that's policy. We asked to speak to a manager & when he came out he right away said sorry we can't let you in with drinks. I said it was ridiculous & i guess we'll take our business elsewhere. He just said...ok thank you! The customer service  (or the lack of) is the worst ever! We are in Vegas after all & the fact that they wouldn't accommodate us was unacceptable! We will definitely not ever go back to any Bubba Gumps again! I wanted to rate them with zero stars but had to give them at least one. Soo disappointed!
We're this location first time, I like there , nice view, my husband got the build your own plate, that was delicious, my clam chowder just ok , the service was very friendly,

This Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. was fantastic. It was pretty expensive (as expected on The Strip), but besides that everything was cooked beautifully and service was top top notch. Tried Bubba's "Bucket of Boat Trash" and also shared the shrimp appetizer. Would highly recommend! Vegas has practically every restaurant you can think of so you never know where to go, but this is a good option.

The fish and chips were pathetic. They were the size of large sardines, not exaggerating. I've had this dish before at another bubba gumps so I asked if it was a mistake and the waiter was so rude about it. He made it clear he disliked me. But the drinks were yummy, I had the hurricane I believe. I won't go back to this particular store but I do like the chain as a whole. Usually really good calamari and the big sampler is what I always get.

What can I say about "Bubba Shrimp Co", we had a good time but the food was just okay, I had never eaten there before and wanted to try it out, it was just okay, nothing to write home about...  I know its a big chain restaurant but I was expecting a little more out of the food...

Had this place really late, not sure why... Went ahead and are the coconut shrimp and the New Orleans shrimp... Both were average at best. I do feel like this place is a bit overpriced for what you get and there are plenty of other options around. However, if you want shrimp, they have plenty of it. Just don't expect to be "wow'd".

Let me say this first....I loooooove the movie Forrest Gump.  I could NOT wait to try Bubba Gump Shrimp....  Hard swallow (drinks water)....  BUT....this place...NO ma'am!!!!  Customer service is horrible, food is not southern, my group felt we were treated different (I will use that word), AND to top it all off, there is no mention of BUBBA!!!!  Well, as I stated, I am a fan....I went to see memorabilia and that I did.  There was "Forrest" memorabilia everywhere, from downstairs to upstairs.  The decor was nice, hence my one star.  I can say that part of the experience was nice.  However, as we looked in the store downstairs, on the walls, upstairs in the restaurant, we noticed there were lots of mention of Forrest, his extended family, Jenny, LT. Dan but no Bubba Gump.  I didn't see his extended family nor pictures of him.  Definitely left us ALL confused, but we climbed the stairs to the restaurant.  Now, to the Restaurant.  When we were seated, we opted for the patio, but as we sat there for 30 minutes with no drinks and watched others being served, it was decided that was a bad decision.  We moved ourselves to the inside.  It was comfy in both spaces.  We just wanted fresh air and scenery.  The patio offers a nice view of the strip.  Great for people watching while you wait on your food.  BUT....inside we were met with annoyance and poor customer interaction.  I opted for the fish sandwich,  as a look on yelp offered some nice looking fish.  I am southern, so my expectations were high.  When the food arrived, I must say, I was looking very sad. I probably should have ordered shrimp since it's in the name.  The sandwich was Cod.  I am not a fan of Cod, I expected something else.  It was thick cut Cod with heavy coating, more than needed in my opinion.  But, it was bland coating so it was just useless.  The fish wasn't seasoned either, so blah!!!  I won't speak on the rest of the food since I only "tasted" the sandwich.  There was enough food on the strip that I didn't need to eat something I didn't find great.  The plated food was a bit warm rather than hot so the group sent back a few items.  This didn't turn out well.  As new items were ordered and we were still charged for items sent back.  Well, that definitely made for frustration on  both sides.  When a manager was asked for, 30 minutes later, no manager.  We agreed to just pay and leave.  Never Ever again.....  Not worth the hassle.  Please change the name.  Bubba is no where in the building....

This place has a great atmosphere and when you sit outside you have a nice view of the strip. The food isnt anything spectacular and the service was lacking. I probably wouldnt return but I am glad i checked the place out.

This review is about a month old. But anyways, I went to Vegas on a Monday and really didn't know what to eat so I pulled out my phone and started yelping. Bubba Gump came up so I told myself thats what i will have for dinner. I walked in and noticed this place is very big and very clean. I was seated right away. I ordered Forrest Seafood Feast! AND DAMN WHAT IT GOOD! It didn't look like a whole lot of food but it filled me up, The service is very good as well. All n all when i'm in Vegas again I would most definitely be back.

The bartender served us a hard as a brick bun (you can hear the hardness when you tap it with a knife and when you run your fork over the inside of the bun) for the mushroom burger. I demonstrated how hard the bun was since the bartender didn't know what to say or do. I stated I'm hungry now and she wanted to take the burger back versus having the manager come over or put in another order.  Given my condition, I need to eat now not later. I told the bartender I'll just got somewhere else to eat.   Well my partner stopped eating so we can get something else to eat. I wanted to leave (and did leave) everything else unfinished so I can go. Our entire order was this awful mushroom burger, water (for 1 person although we asked for water for starters), an adult beverage (the bartender had to make two different once but they still wasn't good) and calamari. We asked to speak to the manager and Bud, shift manager or whatever he is, waltzed over and with a nasty attitude and said we have to pay for the unfinished items versus offer a solution. Bud claimed him and the chef were sitting and watching us. They didn't proactively intervene.   Forget customer satisfaction or service, we paid for the unfinished items cash (surprise surprise Bud we had money for our meal and then some) and walked out. Matt Stensrude, general manager, needs to work with their poorly trained chef, unskilled/inexperienced bartender and definitely Bud with his customer service, managerial skills. I hope they are happy with this $23.56 cash they got for poor service and awful food; I knew Bubba Gump restaurants to be so hard up for cash to treat us as such. No tip for poor service and food!   This location will not receive another penny from me and I generally love Bubba Gump restaurants; I have been to several from Hawaii, NYC to Miami plus a few in between. This place and the management sucks to no end!
We were shown to our table and after about 15 minutes without being waited on at all (and asking a nearby employee if they could find us our waiter or bring some water) we left.

We came here4 for lunch & just love Bubba Gump's.  Our waitress, Eva, was very friendly & attentive.  I had the appetizer sampler with chicken strips, hush puppies, cajon shrimp, spinach dip, & tortilla chips.  The chicken strips are tender with a lite badder, the hush puppies have the right corn meel badder to shrimp ratio, the cajon shrimp have a kick, & the spinach dip is cheesy spinachy goodness with fresh tortilla chips.  For dessert, the bread pudding is a great way yo go with soft bread & a warm filling.  Round it off with a Long Island & you will not be disappointed.  My mother, aunt, & uncle enjoyed their food & drinks alike.  My uncle even got a free glass which he loved.  I loved the upbeat atmosphere & mix of pop music going.  So, for wonderfulo southern fare with friendly service in a casual upbeat atmosphere, Bubba Gump's cannot be beat.  Keep up the good work guys.

WTH? It's Tuesday, there are seats outside. oh, thanks for not seating me out there, why do you have propane heaters blasting? OH, everyone in this town is a whimp..... You're fish is overcooked like the regulars only, rubbery not leathery. Sad, don't bother, you're in Vegas and this place is too corporate with employees expecting and making more than they're worth off of sucky food.

I worked at the Bubba Gump in Kailua Kona, HI; so I have been in love ever since and was Extremely happy they opened one in Las Vegas, NV. So my husband and I went for dinner on Friday evening.   Location:  Is perfect if you ask me, the outside balcony seating that over looks the strip is great. They have the same Forrest Gump memorabilia everywhere. Only thing I didn't like was the entrance to (well all the people), you get to the front where there is a booth and the hostess radios how many (fine) they direct you through the gift shop up the stair (OK) there is a guy that tells you to enjoy your meal at the bottom of the stairs (nice) then you get to the top of the stairs where a person then tells you to follow the yellow smiley faces to another set of hostess. (at that point too much) which from there you are finally seated. I think they should have the booth out front and then one at the top of the stairs.   Food & Service: Our server was amazing and very nice, while we waited they did the traditional trivia of the movie Forrest Gump. The food we got the Crab Stuffed Mushrooms for an appetizer, they were good but the pan was hotter than the inside of my crab. It was tasty but could have been better, next time we'll get something different. I got the Jambalaya (which the server tells me its the spiciest thing on the menu) of course I'm like that's fine (thinking everyone has their own version of spicy) it was spicy but it wasn't too hot where I couldn't eat it; YUMMY! I wanted the Gumbo but didn't see it on the menu and over heard another waitress say they didn't have it. My husband got the Accidental Fish and Shrimp (the fish is Mahi Mahi) it was delicious as well, the fish was cooked perfectly. We ended up splitting each others dishes (half and half) that's how good both were.
Bubba gump is always a reliable place to eat. You know exactly what you're going to get. This one is without Forrest's favorite drink Dr Pepper. Of course they don't have it so I really want it.

We arrived around 9pm. Not a huge line and we got a table quick. We decided to sit outside- best decision ever! It was a wonderful night and we could see the whole Strip lit up. I ordered something off the seasonal menu. Essentially it was 4 different formats of shrimp (bacon wrapped, grilled, crab stuffed and sauteed), jasmine rice, spinach and grape tomatoes. Portions are important to talk about, it was good (dare I say even a bit more than you should eat in one seating lol) My favorite was the bacon wrapped by far. If you love crab then the stuffed ones would make you happy since they really do have the crab taste (have had those in other places and the taste of crab has been weaker). The rice was not as loose as I like but it wasnt bland nor too salty. Both of my other friends ordered a sampler of 4 different formats of shrimp (3 fried and 1 grilled). They came with fries. They liked the Coconut ones best by far.  The restaurant has a lot of cool Forrest Gump memorabilia and spots to take pictures. All three of us were happy campers.

If you want a good experience, avoid Bubba Gump Shrimp. Terrible experience with a poor management team. Our server Jon was wonderful and did as much as he could possibly do within his authority. Unfortunately, the managers Bud and Dennis were awful. I'm writing corporate tomorrow.

Love this place. Been here a few times now I am a local here in vegas. More locals should visit. The first time the homie Carlos was a great waiter and then Amanda was awesome the next time around. Still Carlos was more awesome not that Amanda was bad or anything. Then Q from down stairs acted like a fairy and made our experienced incredible. Will be back for sure!

I wanted to try Bubba Gump's to see what the hype was all about. It's not hype! The food was amazing. I had the "I'm stuffed" shrimp. Hands down the best seafood dish I've had in a while. I would definitely recommend if you're looking for an affordable seafood restaurant in the strip.

My wife and I hag dinner on Sunday night. Food was good. We sat outside on the balcony facing Las Vegas boulevard and the view was amazing. Service was fast and courteous. It's a good place to eat. Nothing different from other Bubba Gump restaurants. Same menu. I order a burger I was so hungry after running a. Half marathon and it was very good. Will come back mostly for the view.

Ordered the  shrimp scampi and Stuffed shrimp. The shrimp in both dishes were over cooked and the crab was in indiscernible. The service wasn't any better. We ordered an appetizer which was good, but the salad came right after and then main course so the table was filled. We needed water but could not get waiter attention because too busy flirting. Will not go to another Bubba Gump.

This is our 3rd time going to this place and it never lets us down. The food is good, the drinks are little pricey but you get a souvenir cup with most of them. Love the atmosphere and the staff. On our firs trip the manager himself came and helped us when we had a question. This most recent time we went, we seen the manager actually pick up the broom help really quick. great place!

I was curious to check this place out because Forrest Gump is one of my favorite movies. I stopped by on a sunny afternoon and the hostess took me to my table facing Las Vegas Boulevard. The food was fantastic. I got a shrimp sandwich and French fries. The portion was huge and the prices for food and drinks were very reasonable for a restaurant on the strip. My waitress Cara was adorable and stopped by a few time to ask me if everything was ok. The service was pretty fast too. I loved every bite and can't wait to come back.

Enjoyed my Delicious meal! We had the accidental mahi mahi fish and shrimp and seafood feast! Food was well prepared and staff was friendly. For a Sat. Night the restaurant was not busy like other Vegas restaurants.

It was a great idea to go to Bubba Gump for dinner. We had table outside with a perfect view!! Shrimp were great and special thanks to our server. Unfortunately don't remember his name but he was working with trainee (around 8 pm on 27th of October). So professional and friendly! We had a great evening!
the experience was good, good food and laughs. I do think it is a tiny bit over priced... $6 for a side salad..and about $16 for a pilsner beer. But overall it was good
